The capable, prudent man should empty a private place for her with trustworthy women. Entering at night is better; a group of the predecessors mentioned that. If she wants to enter for menstruation or the like of what she must do, she intends that intention from her house so her walking to it becomes worship.
Second Condition: That women do not mix with foreign men.
Third Condition: That they do not enter except with a waistcloth covering [what prevents] the skin from appearing, like the covering of prayer. Men and women share in this according to the more correct view; because Allah Almighty is more worthy to be shy of, so covering is obligatory so Allah Almighty does not see him abandoning His etiquette and what He commanded him. If a guardian brings a boy into the bathhouse, he must cover him, and likewise the girl if they reached the limit of desire.
Fourth Condition: That they do not enter the bathhouse except with Muslim women. If a woman enters with Kitabi or Harbi women, there are two views: The more correct in *Al-Sharh* and *Al-Rawdah* in the Book of Marriage and Jizya: Prohibition.

Chapter
On the Harms that Befall a Woman in Her Going Out and the Sin She Incurs

Our Sheikh said: In the Musnad of Imam Ahmad, may Allah be pleased with him, that the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Any woman who applies perfume then goes out to the road is an adulteress."
Aisha, may Allah be pleased with her, said: "If the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, had seen what women introduced after him, he would have prevented them from the mosques, as the women of Banu Israel were prevented." Agreed upon. This is her saying about the women of her time, so how about if she saw the women of our time? But we ask Allah for pardon and safety for us and them and for the nation of Muhammad, all together.

Harms of women coming to bathhouses:
Some of them said: Coming of women to the bathhouse results in many harms, among them: Leaving prayer at its time. Among them: Showing adornment which she was commanded to hide from strangers, and show to the husband. Among them: Disturbing men with what appears from under the wrap of jewelry and colored cloth. Among them: Her walking swaying. Among them: Showing the scent of perfume and similar scandals done by women of some of this time. This opens the ways of Satan and harms many people.
From Mu'adh ibn Jabal, may Allah be pleased with him, he said: The most fearful thing I fear for you is the temptation of women when they wear gold bracelets and wear the Riyt (thin cloths) of Sham and the Asb (Yemeni cloth) of Yemen, tiring the rich and burdening the poor with what he cannot find. Narrated by Ahmad.
From Abu Umamah, may Allah be pleased with him, that the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, said: When Iblis - may Allah curse him - was sent down to earth, he said: My Lord, make a house for me. He said: The bathhouse. He said: Make a gathering place for me. He said: Markets and road intersections. He said: Make traps for me. He said: Women."
In the Sahih from the Hadith of Usama, may Allah be pleased with him, that the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "I have not left after me a temptation more harmful to men than women."
In Sahih Muslim: "So fear the world and fear women, for the first trial of Banu Israel was in women."
From Ibn Mas'ud, may Allah be pleased with them both, that the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "When a woman goes out, the devil raises his head at her. The closest a woman is to her Lord is when she is in the depth of her house." Narrated by Abu Dawood and Al-Tirmidhi.
Among the harms resulting from entering the bathhouse: The corrupting woman may not be able to do what she wants except with the excuse of the bathhouse. For the plot of women is greater than the plot of Satan as Allah Almighty said: (Indeed, your plot is great). Luqman said to his son while admonishing him: O my son, disobey women in good so they do not bring you evil. Fear their worst, and be on guard with their best, for they do not hasten to good, but rather they are faster to evil. We ask Allah for safety by His grace and generosity.

Chapter
Etiquettes and Rulings Inside the Bathhouse

Inside the bathhouse, one guards against looking at bodies, for looking at them with desire is forbidden for him, whether it is the body of a beardless boy or a bearded man, and whether it is the face or otherwise. Touching the whole body with desire is forbidden. He must denounce what he sees contrary to the Sunnah with his hand, tongue, or heart as mentioned in the famous authentic Hadith.

Cover yourself, may Allah cover you:

book_title: Salwat al-Ahzan lil-Ijtinab 'an Majalisat al-Ahdath wal-Niswan
text:
He should command gently and say to the one with exposed Awrah: Cover yourself, may Allah cover you. And say to him: Exposing the Awrah is forbidden. Whoever enters the bathhouse without a covering has committed transgression (*Fisq*), and his testimony is not accepted, whether man or woman. Likewise if he enters with a covering then removes it in the presence of people, and sits naked washing with Sidr and the like, that is Fisq dropping testimony. If he sees a naked person without covering, he returns or casts his gaze to the ground and faces the wall as Ibn Umar, may Allah be pleased with them both, did.

Duty of the Muslim upon entering the bathhouse:
Sufyan ibn Uyaynah, may Allah have mercy on him, said: They used to like that when they entered the bathhouse to say: O Good One (*Barr*), O Merciful, bestow upon us, and protect us from the punishment of the Scorching Fire. From Ibn Umar, may Allah be pleased with them both, that when he entered the bathhouse he put his hand in the basin and said: In the name of Allah, what a good house is the bathhouse for one who wants to remember, and what a miserable house is the bathhouse for one from whom Allah has removed shame. And he says when people crowd and engage in their confusion: O Allah, I ask You for safety from the terror of the Day of Resurrection.

Chapter
On the Prohibition of Using Clay in the Bathhouse

The author of *Al-Ilmam* said: If the washer enters the bathhouse to wash from Janabah, menstruation, postpartum bleeding, or for dirtiness of his head or body or for medical treatment, he may wash with Sidr or Marshmallow (*Khitmi*). But let him beware of using clay (*Tin*) inside the bathhouse or outside it. For it was narrated from Abu Huraira, may Allah be pleased with him, said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Whoever washes his head with clay, he has washed with his flesh, and whoever eats clay eats his flesh."
From Salman from the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him: "Whoever eats clay helps in killing himself."
From Aisha she said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Do not eat clay, for it changes the color, enlarges the belly, and helps in killing."

Chapter
On the Prohibition of Exposing the Awrah in the Bathhouse and Prohibition of Enabling Others to Touch It

Our Sheikh, may Allah have mercy on him, said: It is forbidden for him to enable another to wash his Awrah; rather he undertakes washing it himself. Let him beware of what some lenient transgressors (*Fusaq*) do in that, enabling the bath attendant (*Ballan*) to shave his pubes. This is not practiced except by one in whom all traits of baseness and vileness are complete. It is not lawful for a man or a hermaphrodite to massage the body of a woman, nor a hermaphrodite to massage the body of a man due to the possibility of being a woman. The handsome beardless boy is like the woman in this. There is no harm in what is customary of the bath attendant or another massaging his back and removing dirt with the palm and the like if he does not look at the Awrah or touch it.
Anas narrated raised to Musa ibn Imran, peace be upon him: When he washed, he did not remove his garment until he covered his Awrah with water. In the Hadith from him, peace and blessings be upon him: "Indeed water has inhabitants (*Awamir*) from the angels like the inhabitants of houses; so be shy of them, respect them, and honor them. When you enter the water, do not enter except with a waistcloth."
Al-Nawawi, may Allah have mercy on him, said: Abu Bakr al-Sam'ani, may Allah have mercy on him, used to return if he entered the bathhouse and saw a naked person. He mentioned that it is forbidden to sit among those wading in temptation (Fitna).
It was narrated from Nafi' from Ibn Umar, may Allah be pleased with them both, that he entered the bathhouse wearing a waistcloth. When he arrived, he found them naked. He said: So he turned his face towards the wall then said: Bring me my garment, O Nafi'. I brought it to him, so he wrapped himself in it and covered his face, then handed me his hand. I led him until he exited from it, then he did not enter it after that. It was said to him after that: You cover yourself? He said: I hate to see the Awrah of another.
From Salman al-Farsi, may Allah be pleased with him, that he said: To die then be resurrected then die then be resurrected then die, is dearer to me than seeing the Awrah of a man or him seeing it of me. Ibn Umar refrained from entering the bathhouse for this reason.
Al-Khara'iti supported with chain from Salih al-Dahhan said: Jabir ibn Zayd entered the bathhouse and saw naked people. He said: Glory be to Allah! Are these Muslims? Then he placed his hand over his eyes and left, may Allah be pleased with him and be pleased with us through them. Such was the state of the righteous predecessors, owners of illuminated hearts following the Sunnah; if one of them saw an evil, his heart was disturbed and he fled like a wary animal.
In *Shu'ab al-Iman* by Al-Bayhaqi, may Allah have mercy on him, that Ibn al-Mubarak, may Allah be pleased with him, whenever he exited the bathhouse, he prayed two rak'ahs because of what overcame him and what his sight fell upon. And Allah is the Granter of success and the Helper.

Chapter
On Guarding Against Looking at What Distracts

book_title: Salwat al-Ahzan lil-Ijtinab 'an Majalisat al-Ahdath wal-Niswan
text:
Al-Nawawi said in *Al-Tibyan*: From that is looking at what distracts and scatters the mind. Uglier than this is looking at what is not permissible to look at, like the beardless boy and others. As for looking at a handsome beardless boy without need, it is forbidden whether with desire or without, whether safe from temptation or not. This is the correct chosen school of thought among scholars. Imam Al-Shafi'i, may Allah be pleased with him, and uncountable scholars, may Allah be pleased with them all, have stated its prohibition. Its evidence is His Almighty's saying: (Tell the believing men to reduce [some] of their vision). He is like the woman in meaning; rather, perhaps some or many of them are more beautiful than many women. Causes of doubt are possible in him, and paths of evil are easy regarding him which are not easy regarding a woman; so his prohibition was more appropriate. The sayings in driving away from them are more than can be counted.

The flesh of my face peeled off because of a look!
It was narrated from some of the predecessors that he saw one of the dead in sleep whom he believed to be good. He asked him about his condition. He said to him: The flesh of my face peeled off when I stood before Allah Almighty, out of shame before Him, because of a look I cast at a young man.
As for looking with desire at anyone, be it man or woman, whether the woman is forbidden (Muharrama) or otherwise, except the wife and the owned slave whom one owns for enjoyment—even our companions said: It is forbidden to look with desire at his Mahrams like his daughter. And Allah knows best.

Ruling on boys entering the Mosque:
As for the ruling on boys entering the Mosque, our Sheikh said: Al-Baghdadi said: Al-Mutawalli said: It is disliked to bring animals, madmen, and boys who do not discern into the Mosque because their polluting it is not secure. As for teaching them the Quran in the Mosque, if that is in a manner leading to violating its sanctity, lack of respect for it, disturbing the one praying, and spitting in it, it is prevented; otherwise, no. Ibn Mas'ud, may Allah be pleased with him, used to read the Quran in the Mosque while kneeling on his knees.

Imam Malik's opinion on teaching boys in the Mosque:
Malik was asked about teaching boys in the Mosque. He said: I do not see that permissible; because Mosques were not built for that. Based on that, boys are prevented from entering Mosques without need, such as if they enter for play and amusement, or their voices are raised and they disrespect the Mosque and the like.

Chapter
On the Afflictions Entering upon the Poor (Sufis) from Mixing with Youths

Abu al-Faraj, may Allah have mercy on him, said: Know that most of those imitating the Sufis have closed upon themselves the door of looking at foreign women due to their distance from accompanying them and refraining from mixing with them. They busied themselves with asceticism from marriage. Companionship of youths was negated for them on the path of will (*Irada*) and intent of asceticism. So Iblis inclined them towards it. They are in their companionship of seven types:
First: The most malicious of people. They are people imitating Sufis and professing Incarnation (*Hulul*). Abu Nasr Abdullah ibn Ali al-Sarraj said: It reached me that a group of the Incarnationists claimed that the Truth (Allah) chose bodies in which the meanings of Lordship resided.
Second Type: A group imitating Sufis in their school and intending passionate love (*Ishq*).
Third Type: A group permitting looking at the beautiful. Abu Abd al-Rahman al-Sulami wrote a book he named *Sunan al-Sufiyyah*. He said at the end of the book: Chapter on the collections of their licenses. He mentioned in it what was narrated from the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, that he said: "Seek good with the beautiful of faces," and that he said: "Three things clear the eyesight: Looking at greenery, looking at water, and looking at a beautiful face." These two Hadiths have no basis from the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him. As for the first Hadith, Ibn Ma'in said about it: Muhammad ibn Abd al-Rahman ibn al-Muhib who narrates it from Nafi' from Ibn Umar is nothing. Al-Uqayli said: Nothing is proven from the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, in this. As for the second Hadith: It is fabricated, forged by Abu al-Bakhtari. It is the hadith of Wahb ibn Wahb; he narrated it from Al-Rashid when he was addicted to looking at his son. Scholars do not differ that Abu al-Bakhtari is a fabricator and liar, and Ahmad ibn Umar Abd al-Zanjani [is unknown?]. Scholars do not differ that Abu al-Bakhtari is one of the unknown [in credibility? Or meant: notorious liars]. Then he said: It was appropriate for Al-Sulami, if he mentioned looking at the beautiful, to restrict it to looking at the face of the wife or slave-girl. As for generalizing it, then it is equal [in error].
Abu al-Faraj, may Allah have mercy on him, said: The jurists say: Whoever's desire is aroused when looking at a "beardless boy", it is forbidden for him to look at him. Even if it is the habit of teachers for desire to be aroused when looking at a boy, then looking at him is forbidden. Whenever a person claims that his desire is not aroused when looking at a handsome beardless boy, he is a liar.

book_title: Salwat al-Ahzan lil-Ijtinab 'an Majalisat al-Ahdath wal-Niswan
text:
Fourth Type: A group who say: We do not look with a look of desire, but we look with a look of consideration/lesson (*I'tibar*), and looking does not harm us. This is impossible from them, for natures are equal. So whoever claims his distinction from the sons of his genus in nature claims the impossible as preceded.
Fifth Type: A group who accompanied beardless boys and prevented themselves from immoralities, believing that to be struggling (*Mujahada*). They did not know that the very companionship with them and looking at them with desire is disobedience.
Sixth Type: A group who did not intend companionship of beardless boys. Rather, the boy repents and becomes ascetic and accompanies them on the path of will (*Irada*). So Iblis confuses them and says: Do not prevent him from good. Then their looking at him repeats not by intent, so it stirs temptation in the heart and he wishes until Satan attains the amount possible. Perhaps they trusted in their religion, so Satan provoked them and ascended them to the furthest sins as he did with Barsisa. He made them err from the side of exposing themselves to temptations in the company of one whose company is not safe from temptation.

Supplement transmitted by our Sheikh from Abdullah ibn Ata', may Allah have mercy on him, said: Upon you, O believer, is to lower your gaze when you go out until you return. And let him remember His Almighty's saying: (Tell the believing men to reduce [some] of their vision), the verse. And do not be ungrateful for Allah's blessing, and a trust from Allah is with him so do not be a traitor to Him. And let him remember His Almighty's saying: (Does he not know that Allah sees?). So if you want to see, know that He sees. Let the servant know that if he lowers his gaze, Allah opens his insight (*Basirah*) as a recompense in accordance. Whoever restricts himself in the circle of the witnessed world, Allah expands for him in the circle of the Unseen. He said: No one lowered his gaze from the prohibitions of Allah but that Allah created a light in his heart finding the sweetness of that.

Seventh Type: A group who knew that accompanying beardless boys and looking at them is not permissible, but they did not have patience from that. Abu Bakr al-Razi, may Allah have mercy on him, said: I heard Yusuf ibn al-Husayn say: Everything you see me doing, do it, except accompanying youths (*Ahdath*), for it is the most tempting of temptations. I have covenanted with my Lord more than a hundred times not to accompany a youth.

Chapter
On Refuting a Sect of People and Exposing their Scandals

Ibn al-Hajj said in *Al-Madkhal*: Companionship of beardless boys may be attributed to a sect of people, and perhaps they adorned them with jewelry and dyed clothes, and claim they intend by that inferring the Maker from the made thing. The master Sheikh Al-Qushayri said a great saying in refuting them and exposing their scandals. He said: Whoever Allah afflicts with something of that, he is a servant whom Allah has humiliated and forsaken, and exposed his private parts and revealed his evil in the immediate [world], and he has with Allah Almighty an evil return in the Hereafter.
Al-Wasiti, who is one of the senior Sufis, said: If Allah wants the humiliation of a servant, He throws him to these stinking carcasses. Have they not heard His Almighty's saying: (Tell the believing men to reduce [some] of their vision and guard their private parts. That is purer for them). Ata' said: Every look which the heart desires has no good in it.

Chapter
On the Plots of Satan

book_title: Salwat al-Ahzan lil-Ijtinab 'an Majalisat al-Ahdath wal-Niswan
text:
He said: Among his plots and traps is what he tempted lovers of images with. That, by my life, by Allah, is the "Great Trial" and the grand calamity which enslaved souls to other than their Creator, and possessed souls for those who impose humiliation upon them among their lovers. It cast war between passionate love (*Ishq*) and Monotheism (*Tawhid*), and called to the allegiance of every rebellious devil. So it made the heart a prisoner to desire, and made it [desire] a ruler and prince over it. It filled hearts with temptation and filled them with ordeal, stood between them and their guidance, and diverted them from the path of their goal. It called upon them in the slave market, so it sold them for the cheapest prices, and compensated them with the vilest fortunes and lowest demands instead of high ranks in the chambers of Gardens, let alone what is above that of nearness to the Most Merciful. So [the soul] settled to that vile, base beloved, fear of whom is multiples of its pleasure, and reaching whom is the biggest cause of its harm; including that he may soon turn from a beloved into an enemy, and disown him out of love until it is as if he was never a beloved to him. If he enjoys him in this abode, he will find through him the greatest pain after a while, especially when (Close friends, that Day, will be enemies to each other, except for the righteous). So oh regret of the lover who sold himself to other than the First Beloved for a cheap price, and a fleeting desire whose pleasure went and its consequence remained, and its benefit ended and its harm remained. So the desire went and the misery remained, and the joy vanished and the harm remained. So oh regret for a lover for whom two regrets were combined: regret of missing the Highest Beloved and eternal bliss, and regret of what he endures of fatigue in the painful punishment. There the deceived one knows what merchandise he wasted, and that the one who owned the slavery of his heart was not fit to be for him among the servants and followers. So what calamity is greater than the calamity of a king who stepped down from the throne of his kingdom, and made himself a prisoner to one not fit to be his slave, and was made conquered under his commands and prohibitions? If you saw his heart while in the hand of his beloved, you would see it like a sparrow in the hand of a child subjecting it to the thickets of death while the child amuses himself or plays. Does it befit the rational person to follow this obeyed king for one who imposes evil punishment upon him, and places the greatest veil between him and his Guardian and true Master, whom he cannot do without and must have? For the lover is a slain victim for the one he loves, and he is a humble, abject slave to him. If he calls him, he answers him. If he is told what do you wish, he is the utmost of what he wishes. He finds no intimacy with other than him, and finds no rest with anyone else. So it is worthy for him that no one owns his slavery except the Beloved [Allah], and that he not sell his portion except for the best portion.
Then he said: Among beneficial love is the love of the wife and what the right hand of a man possesses. For it helps in what was legislated for him of marriage and ownership of the right hand in keeping the man and his family chaste, so her soul does not aspire to another. The more complete and stronger the love between the spouses, the more complete and perfect this objective is. Allah Almighty said: (It is He who created you from one soul and created from it its mate that he might dwell in security with her). And He Almighty said: (And of His signs is that He created for you from yourselves mates that you may find tranquillity in them; and He placed between you affection and mercy).

book_title: Salwat al-Ahzan lil-Ijtinab 'an Majalisat al-Ahdath wal-Niswan
text:
In the Sahih, the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, was asked: Who is the most beloved of people to you? He said: "Aisha," may Allah be pleased with her. For this reason, Masruq, may Allah be pleased with him, when narrating from her, used to say: The Truthful woman (*Siddiqa*), daughter of the Truthful man (*Siddiq*), the beloved of the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, the one exonerated from above seven heavens, narrated to me.
It is authentically reported from him, peace and blessings be upon him, that he said: "Made beloved to me from your world are women and perfume, and the coolness of my eye was made in prayer."
So there is no blame on a man in his love for his wife and his passion (*Ishq*) for her, unless that distracts him from what is more beneficial for him of the love of Allah and His Messenger, such that it lowers and decreases it; then it is blameworthy.
Know that beneficial love is three types: Love of Allah, love for the sake of Allah, and love of what helps in obeying Allah. And love of what cuts off from the love of Allah and decreases it [is blameworthy].
Love of Allah is the basis of praiseworthy loves and the basis of faith and Tawhid. The other two types follow it. And love *with* Allah is the basis of Shirk and blameworthy loves. The other two types [of blameworthy love?] follow it. Love of forbidden images and passion for them is among the causes of Shirk. Ibn al-Qayyim said this in his speech on forbidden passion (*Ishq*). He said: And a passion which is abhorrence from Allah and distance from His mercy, and it is the most harmful thing to a servant in his religion and world, is the passion for "beardless boys" (*Murdan*). Just as Allah tested with it those who fell from His eye, were expelled from His door, and whose hearts He distanced from Him. It is among the greatest veils cutting off from Allah Almighty, as some of the predecessors said: If a servant falls from the eye of Allah, He tests him with the love of beardless boys. This love which brought upon the people of Lot what it brought; they only came [to destruction] from this passion. Allah Almighty said: (Indeed, they are in their intoxication, wandering blindly).
The cure for this destructive disease is seeking help from the Turner of hearts, sincerity in resorting to Him, occupying oneself with His remembrance, exposing oneself to His love and nearness, and considering the pain that follows this passion and the pleasure that seduces him causing him to miss the greatest beloved and obtain the greatest disliked thing. If his soul proceeds to this or prefers it, let him say the funeral Takbir over it, and know that calamity has surrounded it. We seek refuge in Allah from this disease.
The further one is from sincerity (*Ikhlas*), the stronger his love for the passion of images. The more sincere and stronger in Tawhid he is, the further he is from the passion of images. For this reason, the wife of Al-Aziz was afflicted with what she was afflicted with of passion due to her Shirk, and Yusuf the Truthful, peace be upon him, was saved by his sincerity. Allah Almighty said: (Thus [it was] that We might turn away from him evil and immorality. Indeed, he was of Our chosen/sincere servants). Evil is passion, and immorality is adultery. So the sincere one is he who made his love pure for Allah, so He saved him from the temptation of the passion of images. The polytheist whose heart is attached to other than Allah did not purify his Tawhid and love for Allah.

Chapter
On Whoever Wants to Marry

If you want to marry, you must seek a righteous woman, and a worshipper is better. Know that marriage is recommended for one who needs it. The basis for its legitimacy is the Book, the Sunnah, and the consensus of the Nation. Allah Almighty said: (And marry the unmarried among you and the righteous among your male slaves and female slaves). He, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "O assembly of youth, whoever among you is able to marry (*Ba'ah*), let him marry, for it is more lowering for the gaze and more guarding for the private part. And whoever is not able, let him fast, for fasting is a shield (*Wija'*) for him," meaning cutting off desire.
He, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Whoever marries a woman for her wealth, Allah Almighty impoverishes him. Whoever marries a woman for her beauty, Allah makes her beauty a curse upon him. Whoever marries a woman for her religion, it is blessed for him and upon him."
He, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Do not marry women for their beauty, for perhaps their beauty will destroy them. And do not marry them for their wealth, for perhaps their wealth will make them tyrannical. But marry them for religion."
From Abdullah ibn Umar, may Allah be pleased with them both, that the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "The world is but enjoyment, and there is nothing of the enjoyment of the world better than a righteous woman."
So if you resolve to propose to a woman, choose. He, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Choose for your sperm."
From Aisha, may Allah be pleased with her, she said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Seek compatible places for your sperm, for the child often resembles his maternal uncles."
He, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Beware of the green manure (*Khadra' al-Diman*)." It was said: What is the green manure, O Messenger of Allah? He said: "The beautiful woman in a bad growing place (environment)."
It was narrated from Yahya ibn Sa'id ibn Dinar, may Allah be pleased with him, from Abu Wajrah Yazid ibn Ubayd from Ata' ibn Yazid from Abu Sa'id al-Khudri that the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said that. Abu Ubaydah said: He meant corruption of lineage if it is feared she is from other than a rightly-guided woman. He only called her green manure likening her to a lush tree in the dung of a camel. The origin of *Diman* is what camels and sheep accumulate of their droppings and urine, so perhaps good plants grow in it. Its root is from *damnatha* (dunging it). He says: Her appearance is beautiful and elegant, but her origin is corrupt.

book_title: Salwat al-Ahzan lil-Ijtinab 'an Majalisat al-Ahdath wal-Niswan
text:
"Notice": Al-Nawawi said in *Sharh Muslim*: The meaning of his saying, peace and blessings be upon him, "whoever among you is able" [means] intercourse due to his ability for its costs, which are the costs of marriage, let him marry. And whoever is unable to have intercourse due to his inability for its costs, upon him is fasting, for it cuts his desire and cuts the evil of his *Mass* (touch/desire) just as castration (*Wija'*) cuts it. This saying directs the address to youths who are a locus of desire for women and are usually not free from it.
The second opinion: That the intended meaning here by *Ba'ah* is the costs of marriage, named by the name of what accompanies it. Its estimation is: Whoever among you is capable of the costs of marriage, let him marry. And whoever is not able, let him fast to repel desire. What led those who say this is that they said: His saying, peace and blessings be upon him: "And whoever is not able, upon him is fasting," and the one incapable of intercourse does not need fasting to repel desire, so interpreting *Ba'ah* as costs became necessary.
As for *Wija'* with Kasra on Waw and Madd, it is crushing the testicles. It is a matter of recommendation, not obligation; so marriage and taking concubines is not obligatory upon him whether [he fears] temptation or not. This is the school of all scholars, and we do not know anyone who obligated it except Dawud and those who agreed with him from the Literalists (*Ahl al-Zahir*). And a narration from Ahmad says: It is only obligatory upon him once in a lifetime. This is the end of Al-Nawawi's words.

Chapter
On the One for Whom Marriage is Disliked

Al-Husni said in the explanation of Abu Shuja' regarding the one who is not yearning, and he has two states:
First: That he does not find the provision for marriage. Marriage is disliked for him due to the commitment to what he cannot fulfill without necessity. In his saying: "O assembly of youth" is a reference to the like of that.
Second State: That he finds the cost of marriage but does not need it, either due to his inability by being *Majbub* (penis cut) or impotent (*Unnah*), or having a permanent illness and the like. This is also disliked for him. If he has no ailment and finds the provision, marriage is not disliked for him. Yes, freeing oneself for worship is better; if he is not occupied with worship, what is better for him? There is a disagreement; the preponderant view is that marriage is better lest idleness and free time lead him to immoralities. End of Sheikh Taqi al-Din al-Husni's words.

Recommendation of looking at the fiancee before the contract:
Know that if a man resolves to marry a woman, it is recommended for him to look at her before the contract. As for the amount he looks at, the school of Al-Shafi'i and the majority of scholars is that he looks at her face and hands. If he is unable to look, he sends a righteous, pious woman to look at her and describe her to him.

Chapter
On the Prophet's Saying: "Whoever turns away from my Sunnah is not of me"

Regarding his saying, peace and blessings be upon him: "Whoever turns away from my Sunnah is not of me," Al-Nawawi said in *Sharh Muslim*: Its interpretation is that its meaning is: Whoever leaves it turning away from it, not believing in it as it is. As for whoever leaves marriage in the manner where leaving it is recommended for him as preceded, or leaves sleeping on the bed due to his inability for it or his occupation with permitted worship or the like, this censure and prohibition do not apply to him. He said: And the meaning of their saying "The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, rejected Uthman ibn Maz'un's celibacy (*Tabattul*)" means: "He forbade him from it." This, according to our companions, is interpreted as applicable to one whose soul yearns for marriage and finds its cost as preceded also, and one whom difficult acts of worship harm. As for turning away from desires and pleasures without harming oneself or missing a right of a wife or other, it is a virtue; there is no prevention from it, rather it is commanded. Al-Nawawi mentioned that in *Sharh Muslim*.

Chapter
On What is Forbidden for Men Regarding Women

Sheikh Taqi al-Din said: The women forbidden by text are fourteen: by lineage, two by breastfeeding, four by in-law relationship, and one by way of combining. The generality of His Almighty's saying gathers all: (Prohibited to you are your mothers) to His saying: (and that you combine two sisters) the verse. Its explanation is in the book of Fiqh; this summary does not bear it.

Chapter
On the Recommendation for One Who Sees a Woman and She Affects Him to Go to his Wife or Slave-girl and Have Intercourse with Her

The woman in her coming and going!

book_title: Salwat al-Ahzan lil-Ijtinab 'an Majalisat al-Ahdath wal-Niswan
text:
He, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Indeed the woman comes in the image of a devil and goes in the image of a devil. So if one of you sees a woman, let him go to his family, for that repels what is in his soul."
In another narration: "If a woman pleases one of you and falls into his heart, let him go to his wife and have intercourse with her, for that repels what is in his soul."
This second narration affirms the first. The meaning of the Hadith: It is recommended for one who sees a woman and she stirs his desire, to go to his wife or slave-girl if he has one, and have intercourse with her to repel his desire, calm his soul, and gather his heart on what he is about.
His saying, peace and blessings be upon him: "Indeed the woman comes in the image of a devil and goes in the image of a devil." Scholars said: The meaning is pointing to desire and inviting to temptation by her beauty, due to what Allah Almighty placed in the souls of men of inclination towards women by finding pleasure in looking at them and what relates to them. So she is likened to Satan in his calling to evil by his whispering and adornment. It is deduced from this that it is appropriate for a man to lower his gaze from seeing her and turn away from her absolutely. Al-Nawawi also mentioned it.

"Notice" On the Prohibition of Imagining the Image of a Foreign Woman During Intercourse
Beware, O my brother, if something of that happens to you, i.e., you looked at a woman then returned to your family, that it happens to you during intercourse that you imagine the woman you saw as if she is your wife, until you witness her with your heart while you are having intercourse with your wife as if you are having intercourse with that woman you saw. That is forbidden, and it is from the plots of Satan. I heard it from our Sheikh, may Allah have mercy on him.

Clarification of What is Done in Marriage Contracts Contrary to the Sunnah
Our Sheikh said: Among them is excess in the dowry (*Sadaq*) of the woman. From Al-Ju'fi, he said: Umar, may Allah be pleased with him, addressed us saying: "Do not go to extremes in the dowries of women. For if it were an honor or piety before Allah Almighty, the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, would have been the first of you to do it. The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, did not give a dowry to any of his wives nor was any of his daughters given a dowry more than twelve Uqiyyahs." In the Hadith of Uqbah "and a Nash". Meaning: half an Uqiyyah. The Uqiyyah is forty Dirhams. There is no limit to its maximum provided he is capable of paying it, that he is not a fornicator, and that he intends to pay it according to what the Sunnah reported in hadiths. They only differed on its minimum, and its minimum is not estimated by anything as reported when some Companions, may Allah be pleased with them, were asked about a woman the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, married: What did he give her as dowry? He said: "The weight of a date stone of gold."

Minimum Dowry according to Abu Hanifa and Malik:
Abu Hanifa and Malik said: Its minimum is what warrants cutting the hand of a thief. And Allah knows best.
Al-Husni said in *Al-Sharh*: Branch: It is forbidden for the husband to cohabit with the woman in Iddah (waiting period) in the house in which she observes Iddah, and entering upon her leads to seclusion, and his seclusion with her is like the seclusion of a foreign woman. Many ignorant people do not see that as forbidden and say: She is my divorcee. This one [should be] informed of the situation; if he believes it permissible after knowing, he disbelieves. If he repents, [good], otherwise his neck is struck. Likewise the ruling of camel-litters attendants (*Akkamin*) who perform Hajj with women; it is not lawful for them to be alone with them. One should not emulate those among the pseudo-jurists who do this, for that is forbidden, forbidden, forbidden.
As for what was reported of the rulings of marriage, its Sunnahs, etiquettes, impediments, and harms: This summary does not bear it. If you need it, seek it in the detailed books of scholars. And Allah is the One sought for help.

Chapter
On the Plots of Satan and His Mockery of Those Tempted by Images
Among the plots of Satan and his mockery of those tempted by images is that one of them wishes/claims that he only loves that beardless boy or that foreign woman for the sake of Allah, not for immorality, and he orders him to fraternize with him. This is of the genus of taking secret lovers (*Mukhadanah*); rather it is a false taking of secret lovers with young boys (*Ahdath*), about whom Allah Almighty said concerning women: (Chaste, not committing unlawful intercourse and not taking secret lovers). And He said regarding men: (Chaste, not committing unlawful intercourse and not taking secret lovers).

book_title: Salwat al-Ahzan lil-Ijtinab 'an Majalisat al-Ahdath wal-Niswan
text:
So they show people that their love for those images is for Allah, and they think taking them as intimates, enjoying them by action or kissing, or enjoying merely by looking, taking as secret lovers, and consorting—and their belief that this is for Allah and that it is an act of closeness and obedience—is among the greatest error, misguidance, and altering of religion. That is of the type of Shirk, and love taken as an idol besides Allah. For their belief that the enjoyment of love, looking, taking as secret lovers, and some touching is for Allah, and that it is love in Him, is Kufr (disbelief) and Shirk like the belief of idol lovers in their idols.
The Sheikh said: Oh wonder, by Allah, at the ruin of these hearts and their heedlessness of the Knower of the Unseen. Hearts occupied with the love of women and beardless boys, and turned away from the love of the Merciful, the Compassionate. That is only because they were filled with desires and darkened by eating Haram and doubtful things, so they became such that they do not see the evil as ugly nor the good as beautiful. O Allah, reform their corruption, straighten their building, drag them to You with the chains of turning [to You], and occupy them with righteous deeds.

"Subtle Point"
Know that whoever loves persons and enables their love in his heart, the image of that person becomes fixed in his heart, witnessing it with his inner secret. He, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "The angels do not enter a house in which there is a dog or an image." If this is regarding houses belonging to creatures made by their hands, what do you think of the heart of the believing servant which is the place of the Lord's gaze, Glorified and Exalted?

Hearts are Allah's Vessels on Earth!
He, peace and blessings be upon him, said in the Divine Hadith: "My earth and My heaven did not contain Me, but the heart of My believing servant contained Me." And his saying, peace and blessings be upon him: "Indeed Allah has vessels in His earth; behold, they are the hearts." So beware that He looks at your heart and finds a place for other than Him, so He loathes you for that. We seek refuge in Allah from a distracter that occupies hearts and tires eyes.

Chapter
On Adultery (Zina)

Our Sheikh Abu al-Abbas Ahmad al-Zahid, may Allah have mercy on him, said: As for adultery, Allah Almighty said: (And do not approach unlawful sexual intercourse). He, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "The adulterer does not commit adultery while he is a believer."
He, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "If a man commits adultery, faith exits from him and is over him like a canopy. If he ceases from it, faith returns to him."
It was narrated from him, peace and blessings be upon him: "Whoever commits adultery or drinks wine, Allah removes faith from him just as a person takes off a shirt from his head. If he repents and returns, it returns to him."
The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Adultery bequeaths poverty." In a report: "The adulterer dies poor and the one who sodomizes (*Mu'allaf*?) dies blind."
Abu Umamah narrated: That a young boy came to the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, and said: Do you permit me to commit adultery? The people shouted at him. The Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Bring him near, bring him near. He said: Come close to me. So he came close to him. He, peace and blessings be upon him, said: Do you like it for your mother? He said: No, may Allah make me your ransom. He said: Likewise people do not like it for their mothers. He, peace and blessings be upon him, said: Do you like it for your daughter? He said: No. He said: Likewise people do not like it for their daughters. Until he mentioned the sister, the paternal aunt, and the maternal aunt, saying: Likewise people do not like it. Then he placed his hand on his chest and said: O Allah, purify him, forgive his sin, and guard his private part. So there was nothing more hateful to him after that than adultery."
In the Hadith: "There is no sin after Shirk with Allah greater than a drop [semen] a man places in a womb that is not lawful for him."

O Assembly of Muslims, Beware of Adultery!
The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "O assembly of Muslims, beware of adultery, for in it are six qualities: three in the world and three in the Hereafter. As for those in the world: Loss of brightness [of face], lasting poverty, and shortening of life. As for those in the Hereafter: The wrath of Allah, bad reckoning, and eternity in the Fire if he does not repent." We seek refuge in Allah from that.

Be Chaste, Your Women Will Be Chaste!
So upon you, O my brother, is chastity, as the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Be chaste, your women will be chaste. Be righteous to your fathers, your sons will be righteous to you. Whoever his brother comes to him apologizing, let him accept that from him, whether he was right or wrong." It was said:
*Be chaste, your women will be chaste regarding the forbidden ... and avoid what does not befit a Muslim.*
*Indeed adultery is a debt; if you lend it ... the repayment will be from your family, so know.*
*O violator of the harems of men and cutter ... of the paths of affection, you lived without honor.*
*If you were free from the lineage of Adam ... you would not be a violator of the sanctity of Adam.*

As You Judge, You Shall Be Judged!

book_title: Salwat al-Ahzan lil-Ijtinab 'an Majalisat al-Ahdath wal-Niswan
text:
So beware of that, O my brother, for the recompense is of the same nature as the deed; as you judge/do, you shall be judged/done to. Among its consequences is the wrath of the Lord. Among its evils is blackness of the face, darkness, and gloom due to the loathing that appears on him to onlookers, darkness of the grave, extinguishing of its light, persistence of poverty, stripping him of the name 'Believer', and exposing himself to dwelling in the Oven (*Tannur*) in which the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, saw the adulterers. The goodness (*Tayyib*) with which the people of chastity are described departs from him, and is replaced by the evil (*Khabith*) with which adulterers are described. Allah Almighty said: (Good women are for good men) to His saying: (Evil women are for evil men), the verse. Allah has forbidden Paradise to every evil person; rather He made it the abode of the good. Allah Almighty said: (Those whom the angels take in death while they are good and pure; [the angels] will say, "Peace be upon you. Enter Paradise for what you used to do").

Desolation of Face and Heart are from the Evils of Adultery!!
Among its evils: Desolation on his face and in his heart. Whoever sits with him feels desolate from him. The chaste person has sweetness on his face and intimacy in his heart; whoever sits with him finds comfort in him.
Evils of Adultery! Know that a man's adultery causes mixing of lineages, corruption of the protected woman, and exposing her to ruin and corruption. In this major sin is the destruction of the world and the Hereafter. How many prohibitions are made lawful in adultery, rights missed, and injustices occurred.

Adultery is a greater corruption than killing!
Among its properties is that it causes poverty, shortens life, clothes its doer in blackness of face, and causes loathing among people. There is no corruption after the corruption of killing greater than its corruption. For this reason, killing was legislated in it in the most heinous, ugly, and difficult ways. If a servant were to hear that his wife or female relative was killed, it would be easier for him than hearing that she committed adultery.
Sa'd ibn Ubadah, may Allah be pleased with him, said: If I saw anyone with my wife, I would strike him with the sword not using the flat side. That reached the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, so he said: "Do you marvel at Sa'd's jealousy? By Allah, I am more jealous than him, and Allah is more jealous than me. Because of Allah's jealousy, Allah forbade immoralities, what is apparent of them and what is concealed." Agreed upon.
In the two Sahihs also from him, peace and blessings be upon him: "Indeed Allah Almighty becomes jealous, and indeed the believer becomes jealous. Allah's jealousy is that the servant commits what Allah has forbidden him."
In the Sahih from him, peace and blessings be upon him: "No one is more jealous than Allah; because of that He forbade immoralities, what is apparent of them and what is concealed. And no one loves praise more than Allah; because of that He praised Himself."

The Ugliest and Most Hideous Adultery!
Among the ugliest and most hideous adultery is a man's adultery with his neighbor's wife. In the Hadith: "To commit adultery with ten women is lighter for him than to commit adultery with his neighbor's wife."

The Greatest Prohibitions:
Among the greatest prohibitions is to have intercourse with women in their anuses. The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Cursed is he who comes to his wife in her anus." He, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "That is the lesser sodomy." He said: "Whoever marries a woman in her anus, or a man, or a boy, will be gathered on the Day of Resurrection smelling worse than a carcass, people will be harmed by him until he enters the Fire. Allah nullifies his reward, and Allah does not accept from them any exchange or ransom. He enters a coffin of fire and it is nailed shut upon him with nails of fire if he does not repent."
He, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Those who do not smell the scent of Paradise: The lying scholar, the stingy rich man, the corrupt old man, the adulterous youth, and the ignorant ascetic."
Among the ugliest adultery is with a foreign woman who has a husband, and with Mahrams. Adultery of a previously married person (*Thayyib*) is uglier than adultery of a virgin. Adultery of an old man is uglier than adultery of a youth. Adultery of a free man is uglier than adultery of a slave. Adultery of a scholar is uglier than adultery of an ignorant person. Adultery of a righteous person is uglier than adultery of a wrongdoer. Among the greatest exaggeration and severity in adultery is where He made Shirk conjoined with adultery. Allah Almighty commanded in the verse: The adulteress and the adulterer, lash each one of them a hundred lashes if they are virgins, not married (*Muhsan*). The Sunnah came with an addition to that, which is exile for a year. As for the Thayyib with the Thayyib, in the Hadith: "The virgin with the virgin, lashing of a hundred and exile for a year. And the Thayyib, lashing of a hundred and stoning with stones," meaning until he dies. If he marries, he becomes Muhsan, even if his wife died or he divorced her. This is the state of adultery with women.

Chapter
On the Corruption of Sodomy (*Liwat*) and its Punishment

book_title: Salwat al-Ahzan lil-Ijtinab 'an Majalisat al-Ahdath wal-Niswan
text:
Since sodomy is more sinful and uglier in obscenity, and its corruption is among the greatest corruptions, its punishment in the world and Hereafter was among the ugliest punishments. It is greater with Allah than adultery with women, which is adultery with males. This is the ugliest of the ugly, and the most obscene of obscenities. Allah Almighty informed in the Quran about the story of the people of Lot, and the magnitude of their calamity as He Almighty said: (Do you commit such immorality as no one has preceded you with from among the worlds? Indeed, you approach men with desire, instead of women), the verse.
Ibn al-Qayyim, may Allah have mercy on him, said: Allah, Glorified and Exalted, did not test anyone of the worlds with this major sin before the people of Lot. He punished them with a punishment He did not punish any nation with other than them. He combined upon them types of punishments: destruction, turning their dwellings upside down upon them, sinking them into the earth, and stoning them with stones from the sky. He made an example of them as He did not make of any nation other than them. That is due to the greatness of the corruption of this crime, from which the earth almost sways from its sides if it is committed upon it, and the angels flee to the regions of the heavens and earth if they witness it, fearing the descent of punishment upon its people, lest it strike them with them. The earth cries out to its Lord, Blessed and Exalted, and the mountains almost move from their places.
It was said: Killing the passive partner (*Maf'ul bihi*) is better for him than having intercourse with him; for if the man has intercourse with him, he has killed him a killing with which no life is hoped; unlike killing him [physically], for he is a wronged martyr, and he only benefits from it in his Hereafter. They said the evidence for this is: That Allah, Glorified and Exalted, made the penalty of the killer up to the choice of the guardian; if he wishes he kills, and if he wishes he pardons. But He made the killing of the sodomite mandatory as a Hadd punishment, as agreed upon by the Companions, may Allah be pleased with them, and indicated by the authentic, explicit Sunnah of the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, which has no contradiction; rather, upon it was the action of his Companions and his Rightly Guided Caliphs, may Allah be pleased with them.
Ibn al-Qayyim also said, may Allah have mercy on him: It is upon every rational person not to walk a path until he knows its safety and its harms, and what that path leads him to of safety or ruin. These two paths [adultery and sodomy] are the destruction of the first and the last people. In them are perils and dooms, and they lead their companion to the ugliest ends and worst resources of destruction. For this reason, Allah, Glorified and Exalted, made the path of adultery an evil path. He Almighty said: (And do not approach unlawful sexual intercourse. Indeed, it is ever an immorality and is evil as a way). If this is the path of adultery, then how about the path of sodomy, where one act of it equals multiples and multiples of multiples of adultery in sin and punishment?

The Path of Adultery is the Worst Path
As for the path of adultery, it is the worst path, and the resting place of its people in Hellfire is the worst resting place. The settlement of their souls in the Barzakh (Interspace) is in an oven of fire, its flames coming to them from beneath them. If the flames come to them, they cry out and rise, then return to their places. They are like this until the Day of Resurrection, as the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, saw in his dream, and the vision of Prophets is truth in which there is no doubt. He said regarding the matter of the oven: There were naked men and women in it, and flames were coming to them from below them. When that flame came to them, they clamored. He, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Then I said: Who are these?" They said: As for the naked men and women who are in the structure like an oven, they are the adulterers and adulteresses. So adultery is greater than drinking wine.
The majestic Imam Ahmad ibn Hanbal, may Allah have mercy on him, said: There is nothing after killing a soul greater than adultery. Adultery gathers all traits of Shirk: lack of religion, loss of piety, corruption of chivalry (*Muru'ah*), and lack of jealousy (*Ghayrah*). You do not find an adulterer with piety, nor fulfillment of covenant, nor truthfulness in speech, nor maintaining a friend, nor complete jealousy for his family. Treachery, lying, betrayal, lack of shame, lack of pride for the harem, and loss of jealousy from the heart are from its branches.

Appearance of Adultery is among the Signs of the Hour and Destruction of the World:
Know that the appearance of adultery is among the signs of the destruction of the world and it is one of the signs of the Hour, as in the two Sahihs from Anas ibn Malik, may Allah be pleased with him, that he said: "Shall I not tell you a hadith that no one after me will tell you? I heard it from the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, saying: 'Among the signs of the Hour is that knowledge will be lifted, ignorance will appear, adultery will spread, men will decrease and women will increase until there will be one guardian for fifty women.'" It has been the way (*Sunnah*) of Allah, Glorified and Exalted, in His creation that upon the appearance of adultery, Allah, Glorified and Exalted, becomes angry with His severest anger. His anger must affect the earth as a punishment.
Abdullah ibn Mas'ud, may Allah be pleased with him, said: Adultery does not appear in a town except that Allah permits its destruction. Some rabbis of Banu Israel saw a son of his winking at a woman, so he said: Gently, O my son. So the father fell from his bed, his spinal cord broke, and his wife miscarried. It was said to him: Is this how you got angry for Me?

Chapter
On Whoever Solicits a Boy or Comes to Him
Abdullah ibn al-Mubarak permitted for the boy, if immorality is sought from him and nothing saves him but killing, to kill the one soliciting him.
Ibn al-Qayyim, may Allah have mercy on him, said: This is what the Sunnah implies, because if it is permissible for him to fight for a dirham of his money, then killing the one forcing him regarding himself is more appropriate, even if it leads to killing him.
Ibn al-Qayyim, may Allah have mercy on him, said: This is consistent with the principles of Imam Ahmad, may Allah have mercy on him, and others of the Imams.
Yazid ibn Harun, may Allah have mercy on him, was asked about sodomites, so he said: The one who comes to the boy between his thighs is the sodomite upon whom is the Hadd punishment. And the one who comes to him in his anus is a disbeliever.
Mujahid said: Abu Huraira - may Allah be pleased with him - said: Whoever comes to a boy has disbelieved - and in another narration from him: Whoever comes to men or women in their anuses has disbelieved.
From Abu Dharr - may Allah be pleased with him -: Whoever comes to men or women in their anuses has disbelieved.

book_title: Salwat al-Ahzan lil-Ijtinab 'an Majalisat al-Ahdath wal-Niswan
text:
And other than that from the beardless boy and the woman. As for hearing singing from a foreign woman and a beardless boy, it is among the greatest prohibitions and most severe corruption in religion.
Al-Shafi'i, may Allah have mercy on him, said: The owner of the slave-girl, if he gathers people to hear her, is a fool whose testimony is rejected. He was harsh in speech regarding him, then said: It is cuckoldry (*Diyathah*); whoever does that is a cuckold (*Dayyuth*). Qadi Abu al-Tayyib said: He only made her owner a fool because he called people to falsehood, and whoever calls people to falsehood is a fool.
Know that hearing singing from a foreign woman and a beardless boy excites sexual desire (*Bah*). Some were asked about the cause that excites; he said: Singing from a bad character, and speech from a beautiful face.
Abdullah ibn Ahmad ibn Hanbal said: I asked my father about singing. He said: Singing grows hypocrisy in the heart; then he mentioned Malik's saying: Only the dissolute (*Fussaq*) do it among us.
Some scholars chose that a person should not hear Quran recitation from a beardless boy. The righteous predecessors, may Allah have mercy on them, if one of them passed by a handsome beardless boy, he would flee from him like his fleeing from a lion, out of fear for himself from temptation. So do not expose yourself, O rational one, to this trial.
A slave-girl asked Bishr al-Hafi about the gate of Harb, so he answered her. Then she came after that with a handsome boy and he asked him. Bishr lowered his head. The boy repeated the question, so the Sheikh closed his eyes. The poor [Sufis] said to the boy: The door is before you. When the youth disappeared, the Sheikh opened his eyes. The poor said to the Sheikh: O Abu Nasr, a slave-girl came to you and you spoke to her and answered her, and a boy came to you and you did not speak to him? He said: It was narrated from Sufyan al-Thawri, may Allah have mercy on him, that he said: If a woman approaches, a devil approaches with her. And if a beardless boy approaches, two devils approach with him. So I feared for myself from his two devils.
Al-Junayd, may Allah have mercy on him, said: A man entered upon Imam Ahmad ibn Hanbal, may Allah have mercy on him. The entrant was one of the leaders of the people, and with him was his son, who was handsome of face and appearance. Ahmad, may Allah have mercy on him, said to him: Do not bring him with you another time.
He said: Usama, may Allah have mercy on him, said: We were reading to a Sheikh, and a boy remained with him reading to him. I wanted to stand up, so he took my hand and said: Be patient until this boy reads. He disliked being alone with him.
Abu Hanifa, may Allah have mercy on him, used to seat Muhammad ibn al-Hasan behind him then teach him, out of fear of temptation and following the Sunnah. For it was reported that the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, made a beardless boy stand up from before him and seated him behind him.

Not letting boys go out to places of corruption is from the Sunnah
From the Sunnah is that a man not enable his child, if he is a boy, to display himself and go out to places from which temptation is feared, out of fear of corruption and distracting the hearts of servants. He should not enable him to mix with men, nor send him with the dissolute to the bathhouse, nor let him sit with the people of rowdiness and the common folk. This is the speech of our Sheikh, may Allah have mercy on him.

Ruling on Masturbation:
"Issue" Masturbation is a major sin. He will come on the Day of Resurrection with his hand pregnant. So fear Allah, O my brother. May Allah save us and you.
"Issue" *Salj* (?) is forbidden. If a person masturbates with his hand, he is punished (*Ta'zir*); because it is a forbidden touching without penetration, and leads to cutting off offspring, so it is forbidden like touching a foreign woman below the private part. It has come: "Cursed is he who marries his hand."

Masturbation Invalidates Fasting
"Issue" If he masturbates and ejaculates, if he is fasting, his fast is invalidated because it is ejaculation from touching, and it is like ejaculation from the act [of intercourse]. And because masturbation is like touching below the private part of a foreign woman in sin and Ta'zir, and likewise in breaking the fast. Whoever masturbates owes makeup (*Qada*).
Sheikh Shihab al-Din ibn al-Salah said in a fatwa he gave: Masturbation with the hand is forbidden, and with a piece of meat is more severe and uglier. A woman's masturbation by inserting something into her vagina is forbidden. All of that is disobedience necessitating Ta'zir on its doer. Yes, if a man masturbates with the hand of his wife or slave-girl, it is lawful because it is part of the permitted enjoyment. He has the right to enjoyment and penetration in all folds of her body except the anal ring, and except between the navel and knee during menstruation days specifically.
As for the boy who inserts something into his anus, it is obligatory on his guardian to hasten to prevent him by beating and otherwise. It is forbidden for him to neglect that and remain silent about it. The guardian sins by his overlooking and silence about it. End.
"Issue" Ibn al-Qayyim said: As for bestiality (intercourse with an animal), the jurists have three opinions on it:

text:
First: That he is disciplined (*yu'addab*) and there is no Hadd punishment on him. This is the opinion of Malik, Abu Hanifa, Al-Shafi'i in one of his two opinions, and the opinion of Ishaq.
The Second Opinion: His ruling is the ruling of the adulterer; he is lashed if he is a virgin, and stoned if he is Muhsan (married). This is the opinion of Al-Hasan.
The Third Opinion: That his ruling is the ruling of the sodomite. Imam Ahmad, may Allah be pleased with him, stated this textually. It diverges on the two narrations regarding his punishment: Is it killing definitively or like an adulterer?
Those who said: "His punishment is the punishment of killing" argued with what Ibn Dawood narrated from the Hadith of Ibn Abbas, may Allah be pleased with them both, from the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him: "Whoever comes to an animal, kill him and kill it with him." They said: And because it is intercourse not permitted in any case, so killing was the Hadd for the intercourse. Those who did not see a Hadd upon him said: The Hadith in it is not authentic; had it been authentic, we would have upheld it, and it would not have been lawful for us to oppose it.
Ismail ibn Sa'id al-Shalanji said: I asked Imam Ahmad ibn Hanbal about the one who comes to an animal? He paused at it. The Hadith of Amr ibn Abi Amr regarding that is not proven.
Al-Tahawi said: The Hadith is weak. Also, it is from the narration of Ibn Abbas, may Allah be pleased with them both, and he gave a fatwa that there is no Hadd upon him. Abu Dawood said: This weakens the Hadith. There is no doubt that the natural deterrent from coming to an animal is stronger than the natural deterrent from sodomy. The two matters are not equal in people's natures as preceded; so appending one to the other is among the most corrupt analogies.

Chapter
On the Afflictions of the Beardless Boy
Sidi Abd al-Aziz al-Dirini, may Allah have mercy on him, said in his summary of Al-Qushayri's Risalah: Among the greatest afflictions for the beardless boy is that he attaches his heart to the love of a creature, for that is among the greatest distractions. One seeks help for safety from that by minimizing mixing with people, especially those towards whom souls incline due to beauty or benevolence.
Sidi Fath al-Mawsili said: I accompanied thirty Sheikhs—may Allah have mercy on them—who were counted among the Abdal. All of them advised me upon my parting from them and said: Beware the companionship of youths.
The verification in this issue is that whoever thinks it likely that if he accompanies youths he will incline towards them with forbidden desire, it is forbidden for him to accompany them. If he accompanies them for a forbidden purpose, it is a major sin. If he accompanies them while having an inclination towards them but he rebukes himself, he is a mixer who combined good deeds and bad deeds. The believer is pleased by the good deed and sees it from Allah Almighty, and the sin grieves him and he asks Allah for forgiveness from it.
As for the one who loves youths and witnesses their beauty, and sees that increasing his expansion with Allah and witnessing the beauty of Allah, this is what they counted as Shirk and Kufr. Whoever is safe from the temptation of loving youths, his heart's attachment to them and intimacy with them is a distracter of the heart. For this reason, they used to forbid the companionship of youths.
As for the one who is safe from the attachment of the heart to them, and accompanies them for the sake of Allah Almighty, guides them, teaches them, and disciplines them, he has a great reward. The benefit of this is not hidden. The young have never ceased benefiting from the companionship of the elders in every age of the ages. In this issue, a human knows his own state, is fair to himself, and dispenses with the fatwa of others. End of Sheikh Abd al-Aziz's words, may Allah have mercy on him.
Sidi Fath al-Mawsili said: I accompanied thirty Sheikhs; all of them used to advise me upon my leaving him to abandon associating with youths and to eat little.

book_title: Salwat al-Ahzan lil-Ijtinab 'an Majalisat al-Ahdath wal-Niswan
text:
Our Sheikh Shihab al-Din Abu al-Abbas Ahmad al-Zahid, may Allah have mercy on him, said in speaking on Major Sins: Among the major sins is sodomy (*Liwat*), and it is among the greatest major sins except Shirk with Allah—we seek refuge in Allah from it. Allah, Glorified and Exalted, did not combine upon a nation of nations types of punishment as He combined upon the sodomites. He—Glorified and Exalted—blinded their eyes, blackened their faces, commanded His servant Gabriel, peace be upon him, so he uprooted their villages from their foundation, then turned them upside down upon them making their high part their low part, then caused the earth to swallow them, then rained upon them stones from the sky. He did not combine these punishments on others due to the severity of the corruption of this great sin, its obscenity, its ugliness, the severity of His anger at its people, and His loathing of them.
The Companions, may Allah be pleased with them, agreed on killing its doer, even if their opinions varied on [the method of] killing him. Khalid ibn al-Walid, may Allah be pleased with him, burned him by the order of Abu Bakr, may Allah be pleased with him. Ibn Abbas, may Allah be pleased with them both, said: The highest building in the village is looked for, then he is thrown from it, then followed by stones.
He, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Allah cursed he who does the deed of the people of Lot" twice, and its chain is Hasan.
He said: "Whoever you find doing the deed of the people of Lot, kill the doer and the one done to." In a wording: "Stone the upper and the lower." Imam Ahmad, may Allah have mercy on him, narrated it and acted upon it, and its chain is Hasan.
From Jabir ibn Abdullah that the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Indeed the biggest and most severe thing I fear for my nation is the deed of the people of Lot."
He, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "If the sodomites multiply, Allah Mighty and Majestic lifts His Hand from the creation, so He does not care in which valley they perish."
From Ali ibn Abi Talib, may Allah be pleased with him, he said: I asked the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, about the metamorphosed ones (*Mamsukhat*). He said: "Thirteen persons," and he counted them. It was said: What was the cause of their metamorphosis? He mentioned the reasons for which they were metamorphosed. Among them, the cause of the elephant's metamorphosis was that he was a tyrant sodomite.
From Ibn Abbas, may Allah be pleased with them both, raising it: "Kill the doer and the one done to, and the one who comes to an animal, and the one who comes to Mahrams."
From Jabir from a man from the Companions of the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, he said: I heard the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, saying: "Indeed the most severe thing I fear for my nation after me is the deed of the people of Lot. Let my nation await the punishment when men suffice with men and women with women." The man is Abdullah ibn Anas, may Allah be pleased with them both.
From Ibn Abbas, may Allah be pleased with them both, that the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Allah cursed he who sacrificed to other than Allah. Allah cursed he who changed the land boundaries. He blinded a blind man from the path. Allah cursed he who insulted his parents. And Allah cursed he who did the deed of the people of Lot." In a wording: "And Allah cursed he who did the deed of the people of Lot" three times.
From Abu Huraira, may Allah be pleased with him, that the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Allah cursed seven of His creation from above seven heavens. He repeated the curse on one of them three times, and cursed each one of them a curse that suffices him. He said: Cursed is he who did the deed of the people of Lot, cursed is he who did the deed of the people of Lot, did the deed of the people of Lot. Cursed is he who came to anything of animals. Cursed is he who sacrificed to other than Allah. Cursed is he who was undutiful to his parents. Cursed is he who changed the boundaries of the land. Cursed is he who took as master other than his masters. And he came upon a doer and one done to, and said: Kill them both as Allah killed them, so kill them with stones."
Abu al-Darda, may Allah be pleased with him, stoned a sodomite. Ibn Abbas, may Allah be pleased with them both, said: He is stoned even if he is a virgin. Ali ibn Abi Talib said: He is stoned whether Muhsan (married) or not Muhsan. Khalid ibn al-Walid wrote to Abu Bakr, may Allah be pleased with them both, regarding that. He consulted the Companions, may Allah be pleased with them. The sternest of them in speech was Ali, may Allah be pleased with him. He said: I see that he should be burned with fire. He said: So the Companions of the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, agreed on that. So Abu Bakr wrote to Khalid to burn him with fire. Then Ibn al-Zubayr burned them, then Khalid al-Qushayri.
Mujahid, may Allah be pleased with him, said: If the one who did the deed of the people of Lot washed with every drop of the earth and every drop of the sky, he would still remain impure.
From Abu Huraira, may Allah be pleased with him, raising it: "If the sodomite washed with every drop Allah sent down from the sky, that would never purify him." Narrated by Abu Umar al-Tartusi, may Allah have mercy on him, in the *Book of Prohibition of Sodomy*.
From Malik, he said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Whoever dies from my nation doing the deed of the people of Lot, Allah transfers him to them until he is gathered with them." Ibn al-Qayyim said: This meaning is correct even if this Hadith is not authentic. Allah Almighty said: (Gather those who committed wrong and their *Azwaj* [kinds/spouses] and what they used to worship besides Allah, and guide them to the path of Hellfire). Umar ibn al-Khattab, may Allah be pleased with him, said: Their *Azwaj* means their likes and counterparts. Allah Almighty said: (And when the souls are paired). Al-Nu'man ibn Bashir said from Umar ibn al-Khattab, may Allah be pleased with him: Two men who do the deed for one [goal] enter Paradise by it or enter Hell by it. In a narration from him: The righteous man is paired with the righteous man in Paradise, and the evil man with the evil man in Hell.
A trustworthy man named Abdullah informed me from the righteous brother Sidi Ala' al-Din al-Qutbi, may Allah have mercy on him—and he had companionship with our Sheikh Shihab al-Din al-Zahid, may Allah have mercy on him—that a witnessing was unveiled to him, so he saw a man, dead, shrouded, and on his head [something? text cuts or refers to earlier context]. Sheikh Ala' al-Din was then standing around the pond. We ask Allah for safety. It has been reported that if a sodomite dies and does not repent, he is carried and thrown into the Pool of the People of Lot. No bird, beast, or human drinks from it, and no plant grows in it. It is told that they heard every time at night a snake hissing in the pool hour after hour. It was said that whoever dies upon the deed of the people of Lot, the angels carry him and throw him into it. So beware, O my brother. May Allah save us and you from that by His grace and generosity.
He said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Whoever dies while doing the deed of the people of Lot does not remain in his grave but one hour until Allah sends an angel in the form of a hook/bat (*Khattaf*), so he snatches him from behind him, and throws him into the land of the people of Lot, planting him in the Fire. We seek refuge in Allah from that."

text: [May Allah be pleased] with him: Two men may perform the same deed; through it, they enter Paradise, or through it, they enter the Fire. And in a narration from him: The righteous man is joined with the righteous man in Paradise, and the evil man with the evil man in the Fire. Abdullah bin al-Mubarak permitted a youth, if an immoral act is sought from him and he cannot escape it except by killing, to kill the one seducing him. Ibn al-Qayyim (may Allah have mercy on him) said: This is what the Sunnah requires, because if it is permissible for him to fight [to defend] a dirham of his wealth, then killing the one forcing himself upon him is even more appropriate, even if it leads to killing him. Ibn al-Qayyim (may Allah have mercy on him) said: This is consistent with the principles of Imam Ahmad (may Allah have mercy on him) and other Imams. Yazid bin Harun (may Allah have mercy on him) said, when asked about sodomites: "The one who comes unto a youth between his thighs is the sodomite upon whom is the prescribed punishment (Hadd). And the one who comes unto him in his anus is a disbeliever (Kafir)." Mujahid said: Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) said: "Whoever comes unto a boy has committed disbelief." And in another narration from him: "Whoever comes unto men or women in their anuses has committed disbelief." And from Abu Dharr (may Allah be pleased with him): "Whoever comes unto men or women in their anuses has committed disbelief."

book_title: Salwat al-Ahzan lil-Ijtinab 'an Majalisat al-Ahdath wal-Niswan
text:
Ibn Jurayj said from Ata': The sodomite is exiled from town to town. It was said to Abu Asim: How is he exiled from town to town? He said: A caller calls out about him: "Behold, the blood of so-and-so is wasted [can be shed with impunity]."
From Ibn Umar, may Allah be pleased with them both, said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Five, Allah will not look at them on the Day of Resurrection nor ask about anything of their affair: A man who comes to a man, a woman who comes to a woman, a man who comes to his father's bed [wife], a man who comes to a Mahram, and a man who comes to an animal."
He said: It was written from Ibn Abbas, may Allah be pleased with them both, from the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him: "Allah does not look at a man who came to a man or a woman in her anus."
And from him also: "Whoever leaves the world in a state, his grave emerges in that state, such that the sodomite hangs his penis in the anus of his companion so they are exposed before the heads of creation."
Ibn Abi Dhu'ayb said: From Urwah ibn al-Zubayr: The destruction of the people of Medina is by the deed of the people of Lot.
Some of the predecessors, may Allah have mercy on him, said: If male mounts male, the earth cries out to its Lord and asks permission to swallow them, and Satan flees for fear that the punishment will strike him.
He, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Whoever comes to a menstruating woman or a woman in her anus or a soothsayer and believes him has disbelieved." He said: "And he has become innocent of what Allah sent down upon Muhammad, peace and blessings be upon him." Narrated by Abu Dawood and Al-Tirmidhi.

Chapter
On What is Forbidden of Singing, What is Disliked, and What is Permissible

Sheikh Kamal al-Din al-Damiri said: It was narrated from Abu al-Faraj al-Bazzar: Hearing much singing is forbidden, unlike a little of it. In one view: It is forbidden absolutely. Al-Rafi'i affirmed this in [the chapters of] Sale and Usurpation, saying: It is disobedience. Qadi Abu al-Tayyib narrated its prohibition.
Al-Shafi'i said: If a person becomes associated with singing and is named by it, such that it is said 'So-and-so is a singer', taking wages for his singing, and they invite him to their houses, he is a fool whose testimony is rejected; because he exposed himself to the vilest earning and was attributed to the ugliest causes.

Ruling on Listening (*Sama'*):

book_title: Salwat al-Ahzan lil-Ijtinab 'an Majalisat al-Ahdath wal-Niswan
text:
"Benefit": Qadi Husayn was asked about *Sama'* (listening to music/singing). He said: Whoever among the jurists or others makes a habit of it every week or repeatedly every month has committed Fisq and his testimony is rejected.
Al-Ghazali divided it into: Recommended, Permissible, and Forbidden. Whoever permissible passion for his wife or slave-girl dominates him, it is permissible for him. Whoever forbidden desire dominates him, it is forbidden in his right.
Ibn al-Salah gave a fatwa prohibiting *Sama'* in which tambourine (*Duff*) and flute (*Shabbabah*) are combined.
The Sheikh said: *Sama'* in the customary forms is an evil (*Munkar*) and misguidance. No prophet among the prophets brought it, nor did it come in a revealed book. It is from the characteristics of the actions of the ignorant and devils. Whoever claims it is an act of closeness has lied and fabricated against Allah. Whoever says: It increases taste (*Dhawq*), he is ignorant or a devil.
