He said: Whoever attributes *Sama'* to the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, is to be disciplined severely, punished with a far-reaching punishment (*Ta'zir*), and enters the group of liars against the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him; so let him take his seat in the Fire. The way of Allah's allies and His party and the followers of His Messenger is not that of the people of amusement, play, and falsehood. Denouncing this is permissible with the tongue, heart, and hand.
Whoever among the scholars said *Sama'* is permissible, that is where no tambourine, flute, men, women, one forbidden to look at, or obscene speech are combined in it. A minor sin, if persisted upon, becomes a major sin. Arguing with those who played in the Mosque with spears, and the Hadith of Banu al-Najjar is correct regarding the prohibited type. The scholars of his time from the four schools agreed with the Sheikh on that.
As for what is disliked of singing, he said: Singing without an instrument and listening to it is disliked due to His saying: (And of the people is he who buys the amusement of speech). Ibn Mas'ud said: By Allah, it is singing. Narrated by Al-Hakim, and he said: Authentic chain. Where we said singing and listening are disliked, that is if it is from his wife or slave-girl, not from a foreign woman.
As for the Permissible: Sheikh Kamal al-Din al-Damiri said: *Huda'* (camel driving song) and listening to it is permissible, due to what Al-Nasa'i narrated in *Amal al-Yawm wa al-Laylah* that the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, said to Abdullah ibn Rawahah: "Move the people," so he started reciting Rajaz. He used to chant for the men. Al-Bayhaqi and Al-Bazzar narrated that Ibn Malik used to chant for them too. The two Sheikhs (Bukhari and Muslim) narrated from Anjasha, the black slave, that he chanted for the wives of the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him. The Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, said to him: "O Anjasha, gently with the glass vessels (*Qawarir*)." He likened them to glass vessels because breakage comes quickly to them, and if broken they are not mended. That is because camels, when they hear the *Huda'*, quicken their pace and intensify, disturbing the rider and tiring him. So he forbade him from that because women become weak from the severity of the movement.
*Huda'* with Damma on Ha and with Madd as he vocalized it. It is also called *Hadw*. It is beautifying the melodious voice with permissible urging and the like to lighten the speech, and it generates vigor in the soul. There is no aspect of dislike in it, equal for the chanter and the listener. And Allah knows best.
Al-Ghazali said: Humming with balanced words is customary in places:
Among them the pilgrims: They go around the lands with the drum (*Tabl*) and *Shahin* (flute/instrument?) and singing. That is permissible because they are poems composed in description of the Kaaba, the Maqam, the Hatim, Zamzam, and all the ritual sites, and description of the desert and others. Their effect stirs longing for the Hajj to the Sacred House of Allah. If the drum and *Shahin* are added to it, the effect increases. That is permissible as long as flutes and string instruments (*Awtar*), which are emblems of the wicked, do not enter into it.
Also among the permissible is what warriors are accustomed to for inciting people to war. That is also permissible like the pilgrims.
Also from that are the Rajaz poems which the two Sheikhs heard at the time of meeting. The purpose of it is encouraging the self and the supporters, stirring the self in it for fighting, and boasting of courage and bravery. Beating the *Shahin* in the warriors' camp should be prevented, for its voice is softening, dissolving the knot of courage, weakening the resolve of the soul, stirring longing for family and homeland, and bequeathing lethargy in fighting. Likewise all voices that soften the heart.
From that is what is said during wedding days. From that is the listening of lovers to stir longing for Allah Almighty, for one who loves Allah and loves meeting Him; as long as in all mentioned there is no mention of cheeks, statures, breasts, waists, buttocks, curves, Su'da, Lubna, and Layla. It is not permissible to apply that to Allah, Glorified and Exalted. Nor is it permissible to refer by it to the love of creatures, describing them with that due to forbidden love caused by overwhelming desires. We seek refuge in Allah.
As for what is applied of that to the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, his description, his form, and his good traits and morals, that is sought and encouraged so his nation yearns for him and cries out with blessings upon him. Some scholars said: As for what was of mentioning cheeks and statures, it is not permissible to apply it. And Allah knows best.

Chapter

book_title: Salwat al-Ahzan lil-Ijtinab 'an Majalisat al-Ahdath wal-Niswan
text:
Mentioning the Doubts Clung to by Those Who Permitted Listening to Singing

Some of them argued for the permissibility of singing with the Hadith of Aisha, may Allah be pleased with her, she said: Abu Bakr, may Allah be pleased with him, entered upon me while I had two girls from the girls of the Ansar singing what the Ansar said to each other on the Day of Bu'ath. He said: With the flute of Satan in the house of the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him? The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Leave them, O Abu Bakr, for every people has a festival (Eid) and this is our Eid."
The answer is that the two girls were below the age of puberty (*Mukallafat* - context implies *not* Mukallafat or barely, as 'Jarita' implies young), singing the singing of the Bedouins which was said on the Day of Bu'ath regarding courage and war. When Abu Bakr said that, the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, apologized to him saying: They are days of Eid, and he did not denounce Abu Bakr's saying.
Some of the Knowers (*Arifin*) said: Most of what establishes singing is the passionate love of images. The person of singing is between two matters: either he openly violates decency and becomes a libertine (*Fajir*), or he feigns piety and becomes a hypocrite; for he shows desire for Allah and the Hereafter while his heart boils with desires and love of what Allah and His Messenger hate of the sounds of musical instruments and tools of amusement.
Al-Dahhak, may Allah be pleased with him, said: "Singing is a corruption for the heart, a cause of wrath for the Lord."
Ibn Mas'ud, Al-Hasan, Al-Nakha'i, and Mujahid said regarding His Almighty's saying: (And of the people is he who buys the amusement of speech to mislead from the way of Allah without knowledge), the verse: It is singing. Ibn Mas'ud added: And listening to it.
Mujahid said regarding His Almighty's saying: (And incite [to sin] whoever you can among them with your voice): With singing and flutes.
Abu Ishaq ibn Sha'ban narrated in his book *Al-Zahi* with his chain that the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "It is not lawful to sell singing girls nor to buy them nor to trade in them." And he added: "Nor teach them." Regarding them was revealed (And of the people is he who buys the amusement of speech).
Another added: "By the One who sent me with the truth, no man raises his voice (*'Aqirah*) singing but that Allah Almighty sends at that two devils pounding on his shoulders, they do not cease striking his chest until he is the one who falls silent."

Chapter
On Musical Instruments (*Ma'azif*) and Explaining Their Form

Al-Nawawi said: It is forbidden to use an instrument that is an emblem of drinkers because it is a tool of drinking and invites to it, and in it is imitation of its people, which is forbidden. Likewise, if a group imitates the appearance of wine drinkers, arranges a gathering, brings the tool of drinking and its cups, pours Oxymel (*Sikanjabin*) in it, appoints a cupbearer to circulate among them, and they answer each other with their customary words among themselves, that is forbidden. He said: Like the Tanbur, Oud, Sanj (Cymbals), and Iraqi flute, and listening to them. His saying, peace and blessings be upon him: "There will be among my nation people who make lawful silk (*Khazz* and *Harir*) and musical instruments (*Ma'azif*)." Narrated by Al-Bukhari from his sheikh Hisham ibn Ammar.
As he said in *Al-Ihya*: They invite to drinking wine, and imitating the people of disobedience is forbidden. Among *Ma'azif* are: Rebab, Jank (Harp), and Kamanja (Violin). Playing them is forbidden, which is the usage meant by the author. The first to play the Oud was Lamech son of Methuselah. They said: It is composed of psychological movements that remove grief, strengthen ambition, and increase vigor. This has no validity; because it is the most enchanting of amusements and the most distracting from the remembrance of Allah Almighty and from prayer. I indicated that in the poem (*Manzumah*) by my saying:
*And the tones of the Oud for the sad one ... They said: Remove the trace of sorrows.*
*So decide on prohibition, any decision ... And prudence is not to follow Ibn Hazm.*
*For strings have been permitted by him ... And the Oud and the Tanbur and the Flute.*
The Tanbur is known. The Sanj, Al-Jawhari said: It is brass struck one against another, specific to the Arabs. The stringed one is for the Persians.

book_title: Salwat al-Ahzan lil-Ijtinab 'an Majalisat al-Ahdath wal-Niswan
text:
Sheikh Sharaf al-Din al-Barizi said Al-Rafi'i meant by it the stringed one. This is stranger than him, for Al-Rafi'i said after that: Striking with the castanets (*Safaqatayn*) is forbidden, mentioned by Sheikh Abu Muhammad and others, and the Imam paused [on it]. This is the Arab Sanj. The Sanj was expressed in the Madhhab as *Sillil* with Kasra on the Sad and Tashdid on the Lam with Kasra.
As for the Iraqi flute: It is the one played with strings, and it is with Kasra on the Mim. This is what Al-Baghawi and Ibn Abi Asrun corrected. He said in *Al-Rawdah*: It is the more correct view, and it is this flute called: *Shabbabah*.
Ibn al-Salah said: The disagreement is regarding the Duff (tambourine) which has jingles (*Jalajil*). It is permissible in weddings and walimas due to the Hadith: "Announce the marriage, make it in the mosques, and beat the Duff for it." The preferred view is that the contract be in the mosque, and beating the Duff be elsewhere. It is permissible in circumcision due to what Ibn Abi Shaybah narrated from Umar, may Allah be pleased with him, that when he heard the sound of the Duff, he investigated. If it was in a marriage or circumcision he remained silent, and if it was in other than them he acted with the whip (*Durra*). Jingles may mean the rings and other things made in the *Mazahir* (lutes?) which are customarily played.
Among *Ma'azif* is the "Kubah". Beating the "Kubah" is forbidden. It is a drum with a narrow middle and wide ends, due to what Abu Umamah narrated and Ibn Hibban corrected from Abbas that the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Indeed Allah forbade wine, gambling, and the Kubah," with Damma on the Kaf and Sukun on the Waw.
Among the instruments: *Al-Sayasi*, which are four pieces of wood, the length of a span or less, placed in their hands, two in each hand, clacking them against each other.
*Al-Nafir*: A horn of brass in which a sound is heard.
*Al-Qadib*: These are sticks made of ebony wood, each two and a half cubits long, struck one against the other so a sound is heard from them.
Among the instruments is *Al-Qabz*: It is in the shape of the Oud and *Shashta* except its belly is very small and its neck is long.
Among the instruments is *Al-Shantir*: Made of wood also, square except one of its sides is longer than the rest, its strings are of brass. These instruments are forbidden to use and listen to.
As for the *Qaynah* (singing girl): The intended meaning is the slave-girl who sings for men in the gathering of drinking and others, and the one who does not sing but is taken for immorality, whether she is a virgin or previously married, free or slave. We ask Allah for safety.

Taking types of intoxicants voids the integrity of the just:
"Notice" Know that types of disobedience and instruments of amusement—playing with them, listening to them, and using them from what was mentioned and what will be mentioned later of types of gambling, and taking types of intoxicants—void the integrity (*Adalah*) of the just witnesses, and false testimony is rejected because of it. This is its state in the world along with what it bequeaths of poverty, need, and falling from the eyes of creation. So how about what falls from the eye of Allah? That is a punishment in the world. This is if he is safe from ruin or the oppression of an oppressor. So what will be his state in the Hereafter if he does not repent? We ask Allah for safety and success to the path of peace.

Chapter
On Clarifying the Hadiths Reported in Threatening Against That

It was narrated from Ali, may Allah be pleased with him, from the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, that he said: "If my nation does fifteen traits, punishment will befall it." It was said: What are they, O Messenger of Allah? He said: "When the spoil is [distributed only among] the rich, the trust is [considered] a spoil, Zakat is [considered] a fine, the man obeys his wife and disobeys his mother, is kind to his friend and harsh to his father, voices are raised in the mosques, the leader of the people is the vilest of them, and he is honored for fear of his evil, wines are drunk, silk is worn, singing girls and musical instruments are adopted, and the last of this nation curses the first of it—then let them await at that time a red wind, or swallowing by the earth, or metamorphosis." May Allah protect us from that.

book_title: Solace of Sorrows to Avoid Sitting with Youths and Women
text: "Notice" Know that 'Ma'azif' refers to all instruments of entertainment; there is no disagreement on this. If they were lawful, He would not have condemned them for deeming them lawful, and He would not have coupled their deeming lawful with the deeming lawful of alcohol and "Al-Hir". If it is with the letter Ha and Ra, it means deeming lawful the forbidden private parts (fornication/adultery). If it is with the dotted Kha and Zay (Khazz), it is a type of silk other than what was authentically reported that the Companions wore, as "Khazz" is of two types: one made of silk and the other of wool. This Hadith has been narrated in both ways. Ibn Majah narrated from Malik al-Ash'ari who said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "People from my nation will drink wine, naming it by other than its name. Instruments of music (Ma'azif) will be played over their heads. Allah will cause the earth to swallow them up, and He will make some of them into monkeys and pigs." Its chain of narration is authentic. Allah Almighty has threatened those who deem musical instruments lawful with being swallowed by the earth and transformed into monkeys and pigs. Although the threat is for these actions collectively, each one of them has a share in the condemnation and threat. From Sahl bin Sa'd al-Sa'idi, he said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "There will be in my nation swallowing (by the earth), bombardment (with stones), and transformation." It was said: O Messenger of Allah, when will that be? He said: "When musical instruments and female singers appear, and alcohol is deemed lawful." As for the Hadith of Imran narrated by Al-Tirmidhi: "There will be in my nation swallowing, bombardment, and transformation." A man from the Muslims said: When is that, O Messenger of Allah? He said: "When female singers and musical instruments appear and wines are drunk." Ahmad narrated in his Musnad and Abu Dawood from him that the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Verily, Allah has forbidden wine, gambling, Al-Mizr (a type of nabidh), Al-Kubah (drum), and Al-Ghubayra' (an intoxicant)." As for the Hadith of Ibn Abbas, it is also in the Musnad that the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Verily, Allah has forbidden wine, gambling, Al-Kubah, every intoxicant, and the drum." From Abu Umamah Al-Bahili, narrated by Ahmad in his Musnad from him, from the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, who said: "A group of my nation will spend the night eating, drinking, and playing. Then they will wake up as monkeys and pigs. A wind will be sent against tribes of them, blowing them away as it blew away those before them, because of their deeming lawful of alcohol, playing the tambourines (Dufuf), and taking female singers." And from Abu Umamah from the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, who said: "A people from this nation will spend the night in arrogance, insolence, and play, so they will wake up transformed into monkeys and pigs. And they will surely be afflicted by swallowing (by the earth) and bombardment (from the sky) until people wake up saying: 'The house of so-and-so was swallowed last night! Allah caused the house of so-and-so to be swallowed!' And stones will surely be sent upon them from the sky as were sent upon the people of Lot, upon tribes therein and upon houses therein. And the barren wind which destroyed 'Ad will surely be sent upon them, due to their drinking of alcohol, devouring of usury, taking of female singers, and severing of ties of kinship." As for the Hadith of Ali, may Allah be pleased with him, he said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "If Allah is angry with a nation, then He does not send down the punishment upon them until their prices rise, their lifespans shorten, their trade does not profit, their rains are withheld from them, their rivers do not flow abundantly, and their evil ones are given power over them." As for the Hadith of Aisha, may Allah be pleased with her, she said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "There will be in my nation swallowing (by the earth) and bombardment (from the sky)." I said: O Messenger of Allah, even while they say 'La ilaha illa Allah' (There is no god but Allah)? He said: "When female singers appear, and adultery appears, and alcohol is drunk, and silk is worn, this will happen among us." As for the Hadith of Abdullah bin Sabit, Ibn Abi al-Dunya narrated it from him, saying: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "There will be in my nation musical instruments, and they deemed alcohol lawful." Chapter: On the Stance of Al-Qurtubi Regarding Those Who Permit Listening to Frame Drums (Tarat) and Flutes (Shababat).

book_title: Solace of Sorrows to Avoid Sitting with Youths and Women
text: Al-Qurtubi, may Allah have mercy on him, said: I heard some of those who deviated from the truth and turned away from the straight path, with a group of the poor (Sufis) gathered around him, saying: Listening to frame drums and flutes with beautiful faces and the existing hearing (Sama') is permissible, and it is my school of thought and I profess it! A discussion and desertion occurred between me and him. I said to him: This is a rejected saying and a forbidden act by the consensus of Muslims according to what our Imams have transmitted, as it is debauchery (Fusuq), and because human nature incites looking, and blows into the heart what is not lawful. Whoever says that his nature is different from human nature has lied. He answered defending himself by saying: I only meant by beautiful faces those by which one draws closer to Allah Almighty. I said to him: This is an unsound interpretation and equivocation not on the upright method. Your general statement should have been restricted so that nothing else is understood from it. One only draws closer to Allah Almighty with humble hearts and submissive souls that submitted to His might, feared His greatness, and knew Him with true knowledge. Allah Almighty said: (Those whose hearts tremble when Allah is mentioned) and He Almighty said: (You see their eyes overflowing with tears because of what they recognized of the truth). He did not say their beautiful faces. The overflowing of the eye and the shivering of the skin only emanate from what has settled in the heart of incoming spiritual states. These states do not require listening to strings, nor flute and frame drum. Then, how is it permissible to express the Truth (Allah) in it using Layla and Su'da with a feminine wording, applying it to Allah, as it contains resemblance to the disbelievers and misguidance in their applying the feminine gender to their gods? They said: Al-Lat, Al-Uzza, and Manat, the third, the other. We seek refuge in Allah from sins and disobedience, and we bear witness that there is no god but Allah, and we bear witness that Muhammad is His servant and Messenger, and we ask Him for well-being and protection; indeed, He has power over all things. The First Type of Gambling: Chess. Our Sheikh, may Allah have mercy on him, said: Playing chess is disliked (Makruh), and it is said: Forbidden (Haram). Based on the first (disliked), it is permissible only with conditions: First: That it does not contain images, otherwise it is strictly forbidden. Second: That there is no money involved, otherwise it is gambling. Third: That no duty upon him is lost; if he becomes occupied with it from earning for his dependents, it is forbidden in these cases. Fourth: That his tongue is safe from backbiting and slander, and his hearing from listening to that. Fifth: That he does not persist in playing it, for persistence in it drops one's testimony. Sixth: That he does not play it on the road, as mentioned by some. Seventh: It is like playing with 'Manqalah'. Al-Damiri said: Ibn Al-Athir disliked playing with Manqalah and the chess of the Maghrebis as explained in Al-Matlab, Al-Jawahir, and Al-Muhimmat. Nafi' narrated from Sufyan Al-Thawri from Abu Musa Al-Ash'ari who said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Cursed is he who plays chess, and the one looking at it is like the eater of pig meat." The Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, passed by a people playing chess and said: "What is this distress? Did I not forbid this?! The curse of Allah be upon whoever plays with it." From Abdullah bin Umar, he said: Umar, may Allah be pleased with him, was asked about chess and he said: "It is worse than Nard (Backgammon)." The Second Type of Gambling: Playing with Manqalah. It is like playing chess because it requires thought and looking. Chess (Shatranj) is with Fatha on the Shin and Kasra, and Fatha is more famous. He said: The owner of chess is the most lying of people; he says: "I killed" while he did not kill. From Wathilah bin Al-Asqa' that he said: "Verily, Allah looks at creation every day one hundred and sixty looks; the owner of chess has no share in them." From Abu Hurayrah, may Allah be pleased with him, that the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "If you pass by those who play with Azlam - chess and backgammon - do not greet them." Al-Bayhaqi narrated from Al-Shafi'i, may Allah be pleased with him, that he said: Playing is not a trait of the people of religion and chivalry." The Third Type: Playing with Tab (a game with sticks). It is close to playing with backgammon and it is forbidden. "Branch": Sheikh Kamal al-Din al-Damiri said: The Sheikh, may Allah have mercy on him, gave a fatwa prohibiting Tab because the reliance in it is on what the four sticks produce. Our Sheikh was asked about it and he answered with dislike (Karahah), but prohibition is more apparent in it. The Fourth Type: Playing with the Kamanjah (Violin/Rebab). If there is "money" in it, it is gambling. Sheikh Kamal al-Din al-Damiri said: As for the Kamanjah, if there is an offer (money/goods) in it, it is forbidden, for there is no doubt it is gambling. Playing with pigeons is implied by Al-Rafi'i's words in the chapter on competition. The Fifth Type: Playing with Pigeons.

book_title: Solace of Sorrows to Avoid Sitting with Youths and Women
text: It is among the vices that drop testimony and it is from the actions of the people of Lot. Abu Dawood narrated from Abu Hurayrah, may Allah be pleased with him, who said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, saw a man following a pigeon playing with it, so he said: "A devil following his female devil." Al-Bayhaqi, may Allah have mercy on him, said this. Some scholars interpreted it as the persistence of the pigeon owner in flying it, being occupied with it, and climbing rooftops from which he overlooks the neighbors' houses and their women (Haram) because of it. Then he attributed it to Abu Musa, may Allah be pleased with him, who said: "The plaything of the family of Pharaoh was pigeons." From Ibrahim al-Nakha'i, may Allah be pleased with him, who said: "Whoever plays with flying pigeons will not die until he tastes poverty." From Sufyan al-Thawri, may Allah be pleased with him, who said: I heard that playing with pigeons is from the work of the family of Lot. Sheikh Jamal al-Din said: Keeping them for chicks or carrying "messages" (homing pigeons) is permissible. Playing with swings is disliked. The Sixth Type: Playing with Images (figurines/idols) and gathering people around them. A scholar from the scholars of Sunnah said: In the authentic Hadith "Every amusement is false except a man shooting with his bow, training his horse, and playing with his wife." Al-Halimi, may Allah have mercy on him, said: Everything men amuse themselves with that has no benefit in the immediate nor in the future is false, and turning away from it is better, except these three matters, for they are of the Truth. The Seventh Type: Playing with Nard (Backgammon) and Chess. Reports and verses have been narrated regarding them. The summary of the saying regarding them is that playing with them on the condition of money (gambling) is forbidden by consensus. Playing with them without the condition of money is disputed. He said: Its prohibition is more likely to me. The school of Abu Hanifa and Malik, may Allah have mercy on them, is that it is disliked with a dislike of prohibition (Makruh Tahriman). Imam Ahmad was asked about chess: Is it from the Truth? It was said: What is after the Truth except error...!! From Buraydah, may Allah be pleased with him, from the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him: "Whoever plays with Nardashir (Backgammon), it is as if he dipped his hand in the flesh and blood of a pig." Narrated by Muslim. Al-Halimi, may Allah have mercy on him, said: The meaning of this according to scholars is that he is like one who dipped his hand in pig's flesh and blood in its form because he eats it. In summary, playing Nard is like eating pig meat. From Abu Musa, may Allah be pleased with him, he said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Whoever plays with Nard or Nardashir has disobeyed Allah and His Messenger." From the Mother of the Believers Aisha, may Allah be pleased with her, that she sent to a people living in a house belonging to her who had Nard, saying to them: "If you do not take it out, I will expel you from my house," and she denounced that upon them. In Al-Muwatta', from Nafi' from Ibn Umar, may Allah be pleased with them both, that if he found anyone from his family playing with Nard, he would beat him and break it. From Ibn Umar, may Allah be pleased with him: He used to say: "Nard is Maysir (gambling)." Mentioned by Al-Bayhaqi. Al-Mawardi said: Nard is based on the twelve zodiac signs and the seven planets because its houses are twelve, and the dots on the sides of the width are seven. It is Persian Arabized. The meaning of 'Shir' is sweet. The first to invent it was Ardashir bin Babak. From Abdullah bin Amr bin Al-Aas that he said: "Whoever plays with dice (Ka'bain) for gambling, it is as if he ate pig meat, and whoever plays with them without gambling is like one who greases himself with pig fat." Types of gambling are many. Gambling is taking money in exchange for something by way of overcoming, either by a person's knowledge, or by the strength of an animal he owns, or by Tab, or chess, or Nard, or throwing coins in a hole, or ram butting, or cock fighting, or other than that. This has become prevalent. Everything on which a bet is placed is forbidden and false except what the Sharia has excepted from this prohibited principle, which are three things for the interest of Jihad as the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "There is no contest (Sabq) except in Khuff (camel racing), or Hafir (horse racing), or Nasl (archery)." 'Sabq' is the name of the money stipulated on camel racing which is Khuff, horse racing which is Hafir, and shooting arrows which is Nasl. It is not lawful to take money by overcoming except in these three under the conditions explained by jurists in Fiqh books so that it exits from prohibited gambling for fear of falling into it. There must be an analyst (Muhallil) who gains and does not lose (pays). From Ibn Mas'ud, may Allah be pleased with him, said: To roll two embers in my hand until they extinguish is dearer to me than playing with dice. From Ali, may Allah be pleased with him, that he passed by a people playing chess and said: "What are these statues to which you are devoted? For one of you to touch an ember until it extinguishes is better for him than to touch them." He used to say chess is the gambling of the non-Arabs. Ibn Umar, may Allah be pleased with him, was asked about chess and he said: It is worse than Nard. Abu Musa Al-Ash'ari said: None plays chess except a sinner. Chapter: On Raising and Acquiring a Cat and What is Forbidden to Acquire.

book_title: Solace of Sorrows to Avoid Sitting with Youths and Women
text: It is recommended to raise and acquire a cat due to his saying, peace be upon him: "They are among those who roam around you (tawwafin) and roam around (tawwafat)." Al-Hafiz said: It is recommended to raise and keep it due to this report, because it kills mice and snakes, and killing them is recommended. These are things forbidden for a person to acquire: Among them is the dog for one who does not need it, likewise the kite, the scorpion, the mouse, the speckled crow, wine that is not respected (not for vinegar etc.), the idol and statues, and vessels made of gold and silver or mostly gold or silver. He also said: It is forbidden to acquire the mouse, the Kubah (drum), the drum of amusement, Nard (backgammon), and the shepherds' flute, which is the Shahin of shepherds made of reed, contrary to Al-Ghazali, and it is forbidden to acquire the Shababah (flute). A scholar said: How strange is he who knows that before him are two abodes and he must inhabit one of them, and that inhabiting the Abode of Good and escaping the Abode of Evil is only reached by righteous deeds, and that increase in degrees there is by increase in good deeds here. Yet, with that, he knows that the duration of his stay in this world is limited, and the breaths of his life are counted upon him, while he distracts himself with play right and left, and his heart increases thereby in hardness and ruin. A wall with a door has been struck between this heart and goodness, and the densest veil has been lowered upon it. Indeed we belong to Allah and indeed to Him we shall return. So busy yourselves, O assembly of seekers (Muridin), with Allah Almighty and His obedience in what He commanded and forbade you. Whoever's preoccupation is Allah dies upon 'La ilaha illa Allah', and whoever's preoccupation is other than Him, his passion increases for what he loved; a person dies upon what he lived upon. It was said to a man: Say "La ilaha illa Allah". He said: Ah, Ah, I cannot say it. It was said to another: Say "La ilaha illa Allah". He said: Shah Rukh (Checkmate), I beat you, then he died. It was said to another: Say "La ilaha illa Allah". He started raving with songs until he died. It was said to another: Say "La ilaha illa Allah". He said: What you say does not benefit me. I did not leave a sin but I committed it, then he died and did not say it. It was said to another: Say "La ilaha illa Allah". He said: It does not avail me, and I do not know that I ever prayed a prayer for Allah!! And he did not say it. I was informed by one who attended some beggars at their death: He started saying: A fils (penny) for Allah... A fils for Allah... until he died. I was informed by some merchants that one was dying, so they started instructing him: "La ilaha illa Allah", while he was saying: This piece is cheap, this is a good buy, this is such and such, until he died. Glory be to Allah, how many lessons people have witnessed from this! And what is hidden from them of the conditions of the dying is greater and greater. If this is while his mind, strength, and perfection of perception are present, Satan has gained control over him and used him in what he wants of disobedience to Allah, and his heart has been heedless of the remembrance of Allah Almighty, and his tongue has been disabled from His remembrance and his limbs from His obedience. So what is the thought about him when his strength falls, and his heart and soul are occupied with the pain of agony within him, and Satan gathers his strength against him and rallies against him with all he can to seize an opportunity from him, for that is the end of the deed. So his devil is strongest against him at that time, and he is weakest in that state. So who do you see will be safe from that? There, Allah keeps firm those who believe, with the firm word, in worldly life and in the Hereafter. And Allah sends astray the wrongdoers. And Allah does what He wills. O Allah, keep us firm with the firm word in worldly life and in the Hereafter. Mujahid, may Allah have mercy on him, said: No one dies but the people of his gatherings whom he used to sit with are presented to him at death. If they were people of amusement, then people of amusement; and if they were people of remembrance (Dhikr), then people of remembrance. May Allah make us and you among those who remember. Chapter: On Encouraging Sitting with the Good and Deterring from Sitting with the Wicked.

book_title: Solace of Sorrows to Avoid Sitting with Youths and Women
text: From Abu Musa, he said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "The likeness of a good companion is like the perfume seller; if he does not give you some, you get some of his scent. And the likeness of an evil companion is like the blacksmith; if his fire does not burn you, his sparks will hit you." Abu Hatim, may Allah be pleased with him, said: Reason dictates sticking to the company of the good and leaving the company of the wicked, because the affection of the good is quick to connect and slow to break, while the affection [of the wicked] is quick to break and slow to connect. The company of the wicked breeds bad suspicion of the good, and whoever befriends the wicked is not safe from being included in their group. They said: The wise person must avoid people of suspicion lest he becomes suspicious. Just as the company of the good breeds good, so too the company of the wicked breeds evil. The Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, said to some of his companions: "Do not accompany except a believer, and let no one eat your food except a pious person." Listen to the Almighty's saying: (O Noah, indeed he is not of your family). So Allah, the Mighty and Majestic, forbade His Prophet from saying about his son: "He is of my family"; because of his opposition to Allah and His Messenger. The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said to Salman Al-Farisi: "Salman is from us, the People of the House (Ahl al-Bayt)" due to his obedience to Allah and His Messenger. It was said to the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him: Who is most beloved to you? He said: "Every pious person." Allah Almighty said: (You will not find a people who believe in Allah and the Last Day having affection for those who oppose Allah and His Messenger, even if they were their fathers or their sons or their brothers or their kindred. Those - He has decreed within their hearts faith and supported them with spirit from Him. And We will admit them to gardens beneath which rivers flow, wherein they abide eternally. Allah is pleased with them, and they are pleased with Him - those are the party of Allah. Unquestionably, the party of Allah - they are the successful). Know, may Allah have mercy on you and all Muslims, that a Muslim must love whom Allah loves, draw near to whom Allah Almighty draws near, hate whom Allah Almighty hates, and distance himself from whom Allah Almighty distances. Then he deserves Allah's mercy. He, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Whoever loves for Allah, hates for Allah, gives for Allah, and withholds for Allah has completed faith." So whoever is of the people of obedience and draws near the people of disobedience, Allah distances him. Whoever pleases them has angered Allah. Whoever honors them, Allah humiliates him. Whoever loves them, Allah hates him and gathers him with them, due to his saying, peace and blessings be upon him: "A person is with whom he loves." Jesus, peace be upon him, said: "O assembly of disciples, endear yourselves to Allah by hating the people of disobedience and immorality, and seek the pleasure of Allah Almighty by distancing yourselves from them through His wrath. They said: Who should we sit with? He said: He whose sight reminds you of Allah, whose speech increases you in knowledge of the Hereafter, and whose logic increases your understanding." He said: If the ascetic's neighbors are pleased with him, know that he is a compromiser (Mudahin). He said: Do not sit with youths (Ahdath - beardless boys), for their temptation is more severe than virgins. He said: Do not sit with drinkers of alcohol, do not visit their sick, and do not attend their funerals, for the drinker of alcohol will come on the Day of Resurrection with a blackened face, blue eyes, his tongue lolling on his chest, drooling, disgusting everyone who sees him. A person should not associate except with people of his path if it is in accordance with the Book and the Sunnah, and should not associate with other than his own kind from the innovators. Allah Almighty said: (And do not believe except in those who follow your religion), meaning do not associate except with those who follow your agreement on your states and path. He, peace and blessings be upon him, said reporting from his Lord, the Mighty and Majestic: "Indeed this is a religion I have chosen for Myself, and nothing will rectify it except generosity and good character, so honor it with them as long as you accompany it." Beware of befriending the people of innovation with affection, for it takes away the lights of the hearts, and beautifying their actions bequeaths the hatred of the Truth and distance from Allah, the Mighty and Majestic. Abu Hatim, may Allah be pleased with him, said: The wise person does not sully his honor nor accustom himself to causes of evil by sticking to the company of the wicked, nor does he overlook preserving his honor and training himself by the company of the good. For indeed, people upon testing reveal things contrary to the apparent. From Abu Amr bin Al-Ala, he said: Sa'id bin Jubayr saw me sitting with youths and said: What makes you sit with youths? You must stick to the elders (Sheikhs). Abu Darda' said: A righteous companion is better than solitude, and solitude is better than an evil companion. Dictating good is better than being silent, and silence is better than dictating evil. Abu Hatim said: The wise person does not accompany the wicked; because the company of an evil companion is a piece of fire that breeds grudges. His affection is not upright, nor does he fulfill his covenant. Every companion from whom a person does not benefit good, sitting with a dog is better than his company. Whoever accompanies evil is not safe, just as he who enters an evil entrance is accused. Whoever's friends are wicked, he is the most wicked of them. Just as the good person only accompanies the righteous, likewise the bad person only accompanies the immoral. Some wise men said: Whoever sits with eight types increases in eight things: Whoever sits with the rich increases in lack of gratitude and dissatisfaction with Allah's division, or its reverse.

book_title: Solace of Sorrows to Avoid Sitting with Youths and Women
text: Whoever sits with the Sultan increases in arrogance and hardness of heart. Whoever sits with women, Allah increases him in ignorance and lust. Whoever sits with children, Allah increases him in play and joking. Whoever sits with the immoral (Fussaq), Allah increases him in boldness in sins and procrastination of repentance. Whoever sits with the righteous, Allah increases him in desire for acts of obedience. Whoever sits with scholars, Allah increases him in knowledge and piety (Wara'). Yahya bin Mu'adh said: "Avoid three types of people: Heedless scholars, compromising poor people (Fuqara' - possibly Sufis), and ignorant Sufis." He said: "Company of the people of righteousness bequeaths success in the heart, and company of the people of corruption bequeaths corruption in it." May Allah make us, you, and the Muslims among those granted success to sit with the righteous. Chapter: Warning against the Company of People of Innovation, Sitting with Them, and Greeting Them. Most corruption occurs from mixing with innovators. Our Sheikh, may Allah have mercy on him, said: Know that one of the severest trials is looking into the beliefs of the people of innovation who oppose the belief of this Saved Sect. So beware of them and beware of looking into their beliefs. It has been reported in the tradition from the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, that he said: "Allah does not accept from an innovator fasting, prayer, charity, Hajj, Umrah, Jihad, obligatory charity (Sarf), nor voluntary charity ('Adl). He exits Islam as a hair is pulled out of dough." Aisha, may Allah be pleased with her, said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Whoever honors an innovator has aided in the destruction of Islam." Al-Fudayl bin Iyad, may Allah have mercy on him, said: Whoever loves an innovator, Allah frustrates his deeds and removes the light of Islam from his heart. He said: "A believer looking at a believer is a polish for the heart, and a believer looking at an innovator bequeaths blindness." He said: If you see an innovator on a path, take another path. He said: No deed is raised for an innovator, and whoever aids an innovator has aided in the destruction of Islam. Sufyan said: "Whoever listens to an innovator, Allah will not benefit him with what he heard, and whoever shakes his hand has undone the knots of Islam one by one." Sufyan said: Whoever lends his ear to an innovator has left the protection of Allah Almighty. He said: Do not pray behind one who says faith is without deeds, nor behind one who insults Abu Bakr and Umar. He said: If news reaches you of a man from the People of Sunnah (in the east/west), send him Salam (for they are few). Abd al-Samad bin Zaid said: I heard a man say to Al-Fudayl: Whoever marries his beloved daughter to an innovator has cut her ties of kinship. Whoever sits with an innovator will not be given wisdom. If Allah, the Mighty and Majestic, knows from a man that he hates an innovator, I hope He will forgive him. He said: So beware of the people of innovation and desires, and you must follow the people of the Straight Path. Allah Almighty said: (And this is My path, straight, so follow it; and do not follow [other] ways, for you will be separated from His way). He, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Allah's hand is over the Jama'ah (Community); whoever deviates from them, devils snatch him." Al-Shafi'i, may Allah be pleased with him, said: Whoever wants Allah to open his heart with the light of knowledge, let him adhere to solitude, little eating, and leaving the company of fools. Al-Hafiz Al-Dimyati said: And beware of mixing with the unjust and aiding them, and honoring the people of innovation and loving them. The Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Whoever humiliates an innovator, Allah will secure him on the Day of the Great Terror." Beware of smiling in the face of an oppressor, or making room for him in a gathering, or giving him from your gift. Maymun bin Mahran, may Allah have mercy on him, said: Company of the Sultan is a danger; if you obey him you risk your religion, and if you disobey him you risk your life. Safety is that you do not know him and he does not know you. Al-Qurtubi said: Sufyan Al-Thawri said: "Whoever takes a shield, money, or weapon from an oppressor and fights with it in the path of Allah is cursed with every step he lifts and places until he returns." Beware of loving a wicked person, an oppressor, a sinner, or an innovator, or inclining towards any of them, or smiling in his face. He, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Do not give a wicked person a favor upon me so that You provide him love from me." Beware of leaning towards the oppressors. Allah Almighty said: (And do not incline toward those who do wrong, lest you be touched by the Fire). Beware of loving those who do not deserve love among the erroneous, or accepting kindness from them, for hearts are naturally disposed to love those who are kind to them. Chapter: On the Company of Oppressors (Zalamah) and Being Near Them.

book_title: Solace of Sorrows to Avoid Sitting with Youths and Women
text: Most corruption occurs from the company of oppressors, being near them, and leaning towards them. Most of those who aid in sins and corruption are people from the oppressors among the police and others. People of sin take favors with them to protect them and defend them against those who oppose them. That is because the oppressors have established a regular bribe (Suht) for themselves upon the people of sin and corruption, such as immoral women, and those who have wine or intoxicants of various types kept for sale. When they take this regular bribe from them, they protect them from those who disturb them, confirm them in their sins, and permit them that. Allah Almighty said: (Listeners to falsehood, devourers of Suht [illicit gain]). It was revealed regarding the Jews; they used to listen to those who lied among them, and take bribes from those they judged for, and bribes from those they interceded for. So this noble verse was revealed, and Allah Almighty condemned them for their action. Indeed we belong to Allah and indeed to Him we shall return. Then know that Allah described the oppressors (Zalimin) with sixteen descriptions: First: He described them as those whom Allah does not love, He said: (And Allah does not love the wrongdoers). Second: He described them as those whom Allah does not help, He said: (And the warner has come to you. So taste [the punishment], for there is not for the wrongdoers any helper). Its parallel is: (And the wrongdoers have no protector or helper). Third: He forbade being near them, He said: (And do not incline toward those who do wrong, lest you be touched by the Fire). Its parallel: (Then do not sit after the reminder with the wrongdoing people). Fourth: He mentioned that He does not guide them, He said: (Indeed, Allah does not guide the wrongdoing people). Fifth: He mentioned them as those who do not succeed, He said: (Or deny His signs. Indeed, the wrongdoers will not succeed). Its parallel: (Who will have the [good] consequence of the home. Indeed, the wrongdoers will not succeed). Sixth: He mentioned that He threatened and warned them, He said: (And those who have wronged are going to know to what [kind of] return they will be returned). Its parallel: (And the wrongdoers among these will be struck by the evil consequences of what they earned). Seventh: He mentioned the ruin of their houses, He said: (So those are their houses, desolate because of the wrong they had done). Its parallel: (And how many a city We destroyed while it was committing wrong). Eighth: He mentioned that woe is for them, He said: (So woe to those who have wronged from the punishment of a painful Day). Its parallel: (They said, "O woe to us! Indeed, we were wrongdoers"). Ninth: He mentioned that He has prepared the Fire for them, He said: (Indeed, We have prepared for the wrongdoers a fire). Its parallel: (The outcome for both of them is that they will be in the Fire, abiding eternally therein). Tenth: He mentioned that He resurrects them at death [sic - likely refers to taking souls], He said: (And if you could but see when the wrongdoers are in the overwhelming pangs of death). Its parallel: (Those whom the angels take [in death] while they are wronging themselves). Eleventh: He mentioned that He prepared a painful punishment, He said: (Indeed, the wrongdoers will have a painful punishment). Its parallel: (Those who oppress the people and rebel in the earth without right). Twelfth: He informed of their regret on the Day of Resurrection, He said: (And you will see the wrongdoers, when they see the punishment, saying, "Is there any way for return?"). Its parallel: (O woe to us! We were indeed in heedlessness of this; rather, we were wrongdoers). Thirteenth: Allah cursed them: (Those will be presented before their Lord, and the witnesses will say, "These are the ones who lied against their Lord." Unquestionably, the curse of Allah is upon the wrongdoers). Its parallel: (Then an announcer between them will announce, "The curse of Allah be on the wrongdoers"). Fourteenth: He mentioned their destruction, He said: (That is because your Lord would not destroy the cities for wrong[doing] while their people were unaware). Its parallel His saying: (Indeed, We will destroy the people of this city. Indeed, its people have been wrongdoers). Fifteenth: He mentioned their regret over the wrongdoer, so He, Glory be to Him, said: (And if those who did wrong had all that is in the earth entirely and the like of it with it). Its parallel: (And you will see the wrongdoers fearful of what they have earned). Sixteenth: He mentioned their evil consequences, so He Almighty said: (Those before them denied, so observe how was the end of the wrongdoers). Its parallel: (And they rejected them, while their inner selves were convinced thereof, out of injustice and haughtiness). Al-Siqilli said: The earth shivered and the sky held back [rain] due to the injustice of the wicked. Blessings went away, and good things decreased due to the immorality of the oppressors. The light of day and the darkness of night wept from the malicious deeds and actions. The Noble Scribes (angels) and the Successors Preservers complained to the Lord of the Worlds. So hasten - may Allah have mercy on you - to repentance and desisting, perhaps great matters - in hardships - whose scents have appeared may be repelled thereby. So we ask Allah for salvation from them and safety from their banes. He said: There will be tribulations where a person of religion will not settle in a desert because of the injustice of their sultan, nor reside in a city because of the malice of their scholars, nor remain in a frontier because of the immorality of their reciters. So there is no rest then in the desert except by spending money and preserving religion, and no rest in the frontier except in withdrawal, loneliness, fleeing, isolation, contentment with humility and scarcity, and bidding farewell to all people in religion and worldly life. Chapter: On Avoiding Oppressors.

book_title: Solace of Sorrows to Avoid Sitting with Youths and Women
text: You must avoid oppressors and distance yourself from them. My master Abu Al-Hasan Al-Shadhili, may Allah have mercy on him, said: One should avoid oppressors. A knower from his companions said: And he spoke the truth - may Allah be pleased with him. He said: By avoiding oppressors, safety in religion occurs, because the company of oppressors unveils the light of faith, and by avoiding them is also salvation from the punishment of Allah Almighty. (And do not incline toward those who do wrong, lest you be touched by the Fire). Some scholars said: A person should not live in the places of oppressors for fear that a calamity befalls them and he is struck, or his nature steals from their nature. Prohibition of Blameworthy Places: Some scholars said: The prohibition of blameworthy places has been reported. He said: Abu Dawood narrated from Ali, may Allah be pleased with him, that prayer time came upon him in the "Land of Babylon", so he delayed the prayer until the people left [the place] and said: I heard the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, say: "It is a cursed land." Likewise the "Land of Thamud" for wrath has descended upon it, and likewise "Dwellings of the people of Lot" and "Wadi Muhassir" and similar places. From the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him: In what he narrates from his Lord, the Mighty and Majestic, that He said: (O My servants, indeed I have forbidden injustice upon Myself and made it forbidden among you, so do not oppress one another). From Jabir, may Allah be pleased with him, that the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Beware of injustice, for injustice is darknesses on the Day of Resurrection. And beware of stinginess (Shuhh), for stinginess destroyed those who were before you; it led them to shed their blood and deem their prohibitions lawful." Ali, may Allah be pleased with him, said: "Woe to the oppressors from the wisest of Judges and the Knower of the conscience of concealers." Chapter: On Dealing with the People of the Covenant (Ahl al-Dhimmah). Most corruption occurs from the People of the Covenant, mixing with them, and employing them. Know that a booklet from the words of the Sheikh, the Imam, the Scholar, the Allama Jamal al-Din Abd al-Rahim al-Isnawi al-Shafi'i, may Allah have mercy on him, relating to dealing with the People of the Covenant in what suits them, became available to this poor one (the author). I wrote it in the book because of the need of the people of our time for it, for the affliction has become general by mixing with them and being friendly to them by the ignorant and others from the people of farming and agriculture, and those who put themselves under their mandates due to exchange or extracting money and the like - we ask Allah for safety and well-being from that, and to Him belongs praise and favor. We say: Praise be to Allah who saved us from what He tested many of His creation with. Allah said: (And [mention, O Muhammad], when Allah took a covenant from those who were given the Scripture, [saying], "You must make it clear to the people and not conceal it.") This verse is short and its words are few. I hope, God willing, for whoever Allah qualifies to stand upon it and act according to what is in it, the attainment of great good for him and for the Muslims in the immediate and the future; so let him not return to the whispering of Satan in delaying looking into it, reviewing it time after time, and acting according to what is in it, for he is an enemy flowing through you like blood. Allah Almighty said: (Indeed, Satan is an enemy to you; so take him as an enemy). He Almighty said: (So give good tidings to My servants Who listen to speech and follow the best of it. Those are the ones Allah has guided, and those are people of understanding). He Almighty said: (And let there be [arising] from you a nation inviting to [all that is] good, enjoining what is right and forbidding what is wrong). He Almighty said: ([And they are] those who, if We give them authority in the land, establish prayer and give zakah and enjoin what is right and forbid what is wrong). He Almighty said: (O you who have believed, protect yourselves and your families from a Fire whose fuel is people and stones). He, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "You must enjoin what is right and forbid what is wrong, or Allah will seal your hearts, then you will be among the heedless." Allah Almighty explained in another verse the state of those whose hearts were sealed and became heedless, so He Almighty said: (Those are the ones over whose hearts and hearing and vision Allah has sealed, and it is those who are the heedless. Assuredly, it is they in the Hereafter who will be the losers).

book_title: Solace of Sorrows to Avoid Sitting with Youths and Women
text: In the Hadith: "If Allah intends good for a servant, He sends him someone to remind him if he forgets. And if He intends evil for him, He sends him an evil companion who forbids him from taking advice." When Harun al-Rashid took power, he sat for the people in a public gathering. Bahlul the Madman entered upon him and said: O Commander of the Faithful, beware of evil companions, and rely on a righteous companion who reminds you of the virtues of character if you forget, and looking at whom reminds you if you are heedless. For this is a benefit for you and the people, and greater in reward than what you bring of fasting, prayer, reading, and Hajj. A man throws a word before a ruler, and he acts upon it, filling the earth with corruption. He, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "A man speaks a word, not giving it importance, and he falls by it into the Fire for seventy autumns." Do not be, O Commander of the Faithful, like those about whom Allah Almighty said: (And when it is said to him, "Fear Allah," pride in the sin takes hold of him. Sufficient for him is Hellfire, and wretched is the resting place). He said to him: Increase me. He said: O Commander of the Faithful, Allah Almighty has led the people to you and made your command obeyed among them, your word effective among them, and your order executed among them. That is only so you carry them to perform what Allah commanded, and desist from what Allah forbade, and give from this wealth to the widow, the orphan, the elder, and the wayfarer. O Commander of the Faithful, so-and-so informed me from so-and-so from the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, that he said: "When it is the Day of Resurrection and Allah gathers the first and the last on one plain, He brings the kings and others, and the rulers of people's affairs, and He says to them: I did not enable you in My lands and make My servants obey you to gather wealth and mobilize men, but to gather them for My obedience, execute My command and prohibition among them, honor My allies, humiliate My enemies, and support the oppressed against the oppressors." O Harun, think about how your answer will be in that position when you are brought with your hands tied to your neck, Hellfire before you, and the Angels of Punishment surrounding you waiting for what will be ordered regarding you!! Harun wept intensely! Some of those present said to him: You have troubled the Commander of the Faithful in his gathering! Harun said to them: - May Allah fight you - Indeed the deceived is he whom you deceived, and the happy one is he whom you stayed away from. Then he left his presence. Is it permissible for the money changer of the treasury (Bayt al-Mal) to be a Dhimmi (Non-Muslim subject)?

book_title: Solace of Sorrows to Avoid Sitting with Youths and Women
text: Some scholars said: It is not permissible for the money changer of the treasury to be a Dhimmi, because his word is not accepted regarding whether it (money) is good or bad; because it involves interest (usury/pasture?), so how about employment which texts have demonstrated its prevention? Allah Almighty said: (And I was not to take the misguiders as supporters). And He Almighty said: (O Prophet, fight against the disbelievers and the hypocrites and be harsh upon them). If your Lord commanded harshness, how can you bring them close and make them rulers? And He Almighty said: (O you who have believed, do not take the Jews and the Christians as allies. They are [in fact] allies of one another. And whoever is an ally to them among you - then indeed, he is [one] of them). And He Almighty said: (O you who have believed, if you support Allah, He will support you and plant firmly your feet). And He Almighty said: (O you who have believed, do not take as intimates those other than yourselves, for they will not spare you [any] ruin. They wish you would have hardship. Hatred has already appeared from their mouths, and what their breasts conceal is greater. We have certainly made clear to you the signs, if you will use reason). Intimates (Bitana) means: Those who see the state of Muslims, like knowing the amount of their treasury funds or the count of their army of men. His saying: (La ya'lunakum khabalan) means: They do not fall short, and 'Khabal' is corruption; i.e., they do not fall short and strive to bring corruption to you. His saying: (Waddu ma 'anittum): 'Al-'Anat' is harm and the like. i.e., They wish for your harm. So reflect on this great verse. He, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Whoever is given charge of a matter of my nation's affairs and does not advise them, and does not strive (for them), Paradise is forbidden to him." Thus he made striving obligatory in selecting the fit when equal in fitness. He said: "Whoever appoints a person over a matter of my nation's affairs while thinking there is someone better than him among them has betrayed Allah and His Messenger." Employing disbelievers involves great corruptions, ugly matters, and heinous conditions that an enemy would not wish for his enemy, especially for the enemy of Muslims to wish for the nation of Muhammad, peace be upon him. Among them is their claim that the lands belong to them until now and that Muslims expelled them from them without right, so they steal funds as much as they can, believing they didn't betray or oppress. They see enduring confiscation and punishment as enduring sickness that may befall health. They advise each other to be patient with punishment and show endurance. If forced to give, they bring out the very least, give some of it, and bribe ('Bartalu') with some until they are free. Whoever is in this state in his belief and action, it is not lawful for anyone to appoint him. Among them is that many of the Muslim lands allocated for Muslim interests, current in the fiefs of princes and soldiers, as well as charities endowed for the Muslim poor like a recovered town and others, they divert to themselves, and to churches and monasteries, even though it is not permissible to spend any of that on them. He (the ruler) was able to cut it off but did not, enabling them to take it and giving them power over it; he is liable for it in this world and accountable for it on the Day of Resurrection. Their condition in this trait has become obscene until it exceeded to salaries and provisions current for the interests of mosques. They induce the Prince they work with to cut them off by every way they can, showing saving for him and compassion, then after that they divert them to themselves and their churches. Many of the old Omari mosques have been ruined. The one aiding them in this enters under the severe threat in His saying: (And who is more unjust than he who prevents the name of Allah from being mentioned in His mosques). Among them: They devise stratagems at every time to burn grand mosques, mosques, and Muslim properties, causing crowds of men, women, and children to burn. This happened recently in the "Year of Al-Ghaffar", the year forty-seven. They were caught and confessed against a group of officials that they helped them. They devised a trick by giving some of what they stole with the help of their elders and those in power among them, so they escaped and no harm touched any of them. If that had happened to a Sharif (noble/Muslim), punishment beyond description would have befallen him. Reflect - may Allah grant you success - on these corruptions and ponder them, while the properties they burned are ruins until now, witnessed. So take lesson, O people of vision. All this is a realization of His Almighty's saying: (They will not spare you [any] ruin), i.e., they do not fall short in bringing corruption to you. End of the words of Sheikh Jamal al-Din, may Allah have mercy on him. Imitating Christians in their Festivals and Seasons: Our Sheikh said: Among the innovations is what is done on "Nayruz" of foods, drinks, and corruptions, for that is agreeing with Christians in their festivals and seasons. It is not permissible to agree with them in any of that. It is not permissible to agree with them in seasons in eating milk and others, and what is done of "Sun descent from cutting Karkish", "Dark Saturday". All that is forbidden innovation; it is forbidden for a Muslim to participate with them in any of it, and to accept their gift in their seasons unlike other times. Explanation of What Came Regarding Makkasin (Tax Collectors), 'Ashsharin (Tithe Collectors), and 'Urafa' (Monitors/Leaders):

book_title: Solace of Sorrows to Avoid Sitting with Youths and Women
text: From Uqbah bin Amir, may Allah be pleased with him, that he heard the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, saying: "The owner of Maks (tax) will not enter Paradise." Narrated by Abu Dawood, Ibn Khuzaymah in his Sahih, and Al-Hakim. Al-Baghawi said: He means by 'Sahib al-Maks': The one who takes from merchants when they pass by him a 'Maks' (tax) in the name of the tithe ('Ushr). Al-Hafiz said: As for now, they take a 'Maks' in the name of the tithe and other taxes that have no name, but are something they take unlawfully and as Suht (illicit gain), eating fire in their bellies. Their argument in it is refuted with their Lord, upon them is wrath, and for them is a severe punishment. From Al-Hasan, he said: Uthman bin Abi Al-Aas passed by Kilab bin Umayyah who was sitting at the place of the tithe collector in Basra. He said: What makes you sit here? He said: He employed me in this place - meaning Ziyad. Uthman said to him: Shall I not tell you a Hadith I heard from the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him? He said: Yes. Uthman said: I heard the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, saying: "David, the Prophet of Allah, used to have an hour in which he woke his family saying: O family of David, get up and pray, for this is an hour in which Allah answers supplication except for a magician or a tithe collector ('Ashshar)." So Ibn Umayyah boarded his ship, came to Ziyad, asked to be relieved, and he relieved him. Narrated by Ahmad and Al-Tabarani in Al-Kabir and Al-Awsat. His wording from the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "The gates of heaven are opened at midnight, and a caller calls: Is there any supplicant so he may be answered? Is there any asker so he may be given? Is there any distressed person so his distress may be relieved? There remains no Muslim invoking with a supplication but Allah answers him, except a prostitute running with her private parts or a tithe collector ('Ashshar)." In another narration by him in Al-Kabir also: I heard the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, saying: "Verily, Allah draws near to His creation and forgives whoever asks for forgiveness except a prostitute with her private parts or a tithe collector." From Abu Al-Khayr, he said: Maslamah bin Mukhallad, who was the Emir of Egypt, offered Ruwayfi' bin Thabit to appoint him over the tithe. He said: I heard the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, say: "The owner of the tax (Maks) is in the Fire." Narrated by Ahmad from the narration of Ibn Lahi'ah and Al-Tabarani similarly. It was narrated from Umm Salamah, may Allah be pleased with her, she said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, was in the desert when a caller called: O Messenger of Allah. He turned and saw no one. Then he turned and saw a tied gazelle. She said: Come near me, O Messenger of Allah. He came near her and said: What is your need? She said: I have two fawns in this mountain, so untie me until I go and suckle them, then I will return to you. He said: And you will do it?! She said: May Allah punish me with the punishment of the tithe collector ('Ashshar) if I do not come to you. So he released her, she went, suckled her fawns, then returned, and he tied her up. The Bedouin woke up and said: Do you have a need, O Messenger of Allah? He said: Yes, release this one. So he released her, and she went out running saying: I bear witness that there is no god but Allah and I bear witness that Muhammad is the Messenger of Allah." Narrated by Al-Tabarani. Explanation of 'Urafa' (Monitors/Leaders): From Aisha, may Allah be pleased with her, she said: I heard the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, say: "Woe to the 'Urafa', woe to the trustees (Umana'). People on the Day of Resurrection will wish their forelocks were suspended from the Pleiades, dangling between heaven and earth, and that they had not worked on anything." Narrated by Ahmad. In a Hadith: "The 'Urafa' are in the Fire, and the gambling is in the Fire." From Abu Hurayrah, may Allah be pleased with him, that the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Woe to the Emirs, woe to the 'Urafa'. People on the Day of Resurrection will wish their forelocks were suspended from the Pleiades, dangling between heaven and earth, and that they had not worked on anything." Narrated by Ibn Hibban in his Sahih and Al-Hakim. Sa'd bin Abi Waqqas, may Allah be pleased with him, narrated saying: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "In the Fire is a stone called 'Wayl' (Woe) upon which the 'Urafa' ascend and descend." From Anas, may Allah be pleased with him, that a funeral passed by the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, and he said: "Good for him if he was not an 'Arif' (Monitor)." Narrated by Abu Ya'la and its chain is Hasan, God willing. From Al-Miqdam bin Ma'dikarib, may Allah be pleased with him, that the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, tapped on his shoulders then said: "You have succeeded, O Qadim, if you die and were not an Emir, nor a scribe, nor an 'Arif'." Narrated by Abu Dawood. From Mawdud bin Al-Harith bin Yazid bin Kurayb bin Yazid bin Yusuf bin Haritha Al-Yarbu'i from his father from his grandfather that he came to the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, and said: "O Messenger of Allah, a man from Tamim went away with all my money." The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said to me: "I do not have what to give you. Then he said: Will you be an 'Arif' over your people or shall I not introduce you to your brothers? I said: No. He said: Indeed the 'Arif' is pushed into the Fire with a push." Narrated by Al-Tabarani, and I do not know Mawdud.?

book_title: Solace of Sorrows to Avoid Sitting with Youths and Women
text: From Abu Sa'id and Abu Hurayrah, may Allah be pleased with them both, the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Emirs will surely come over you who bring near the evil people and delay the prayer from its times. So whoever catches that, let him not be an 'Arif' (monitor), nor a policeman (Shurti), nor a collector (Jabi), nor a treasurer." Narrated by Ibn Hibban in his Sahih. I took all these Hadiths from 'Al-Targhib wa Al-Tarhib'. ? Chapter ??? On Ghayrah (Jealousy/Protectiveness). Allah Almighty said: (Say, "My Lord has only forbidden immoralities - what is apparent of them and what is concealed"). Ghayrah is of six types; for each type there is evidence from the Quran which we summarized for fear of prolongation: First: Ghayrah over the actions of bodies, that they be used to serve other than Allah Almighty. Second: Ghayrah over the sayings of the tongue, that other than Him be mentioned by it, so none is invoked but Him and none is mentioned but Him. Third: Ghayrah over the thoughts of the heart (Janan), that other than Him crosses it, so none is watched but Him and none looks upon it but Him. Fourth: Ghayrah over the whisperings of consciences, that other than Him is found in them. Fifth: Ghayrah over the hidden secrets (Sara'ir), that they contain other than Him; so they are not occupied except with Him and are not sincere except to Him. Sixth: Ghayrah over the secrets of secrets, that other than Him views them, and they are not revealed except from Him, and are not pure except [for] Him. Know that Ghayrah is the dislike of sharing. Then Ghayrah is of two kinds: Ghayrah of the Truth (Allah) for the servant: It is that He protects him so He does not give creation a way over his actions, sayings, deeds, breaths, senses, secrets, and conscience. And Ghayrah of the servant for the Truth (Allah): It is that he specializes in magnifying His rights and is sincere in classifying his knowledge, so he does not give creation a way or share in his states. It is not said: He had Ghayrah *over* Allah because that is ignorance and leaving religion, but it is said: He had Ghayrah *for* Allah. The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "No one has more Ghayrah than Allah, Majestic is His Majesty, and because of that He forbade immoralities, what is apparent of them and what is concealed." He, peace be upon him, said: "Verily Allah Almighty has Ghayrah, and Allah's Ghayrah is that the servant commits what Allah forbade upon him." Ma'ruf al-Karkhi - Allah's mercy be upon him - said: The sign of Allah Almighty's hatred for the servant is that you see him busy with what does not concern him. Ishaq bin Ibrahim said: I heard Al-Fudayl bin Iyad - Allah Almighty's mercy be upon him - [saying]: You ask Him for Paradise, and you commit what He dislikes; I have not seen one with less vision than you! Ghayrah of the Truth is that He is not pleased with the sharing of others in what is His right from the obediences of His servant. Ibrahim bin Adham said: Ghayrah is to migrate from other than Him until one reaches the station of intimacy and stands between fear and hope. It was said: Rabi'ah al-Adawiyyah, may Allah be pleased with her, fell ill. It was said to her: What is the cause of your illness? She said: I looked at other than Him, so He disciplined me with Ghayrah so that I might not return. Abu Abdullah al-Husri said: I saw in the desert a barefoot boy walking with great effort, and that was pleasant to his heart in what he was in of witnessing intimacy and connection. I said: O my son, how is the way? He said: Here, and pointed to the sky. I said: How? He said: The universes are all a veil in knowing the Kingdom (Malakut). He said: I found my heart with his words, so I held on to my rags weeping and sobbing. He said: Take from me, for He is Ghayur (possessor of Ghayrah); He destroyed whom He destroyed for their looking at others (Aghyar), and misled whom He misled for their tearing the veils of secrets. Then he disappeared from me as if he were an angel who admonished me and left. So repent to Allah, beware of Allah's Ghayrah, and bind your heart to fear, and fear of Istidraj (gradual lure to destruction). Allah Almighty said: (We will progressively lead them [to destruction] from where they do not know). Chapter: On Fleeing (Firar). Allah Almighty said: (So flee to Allah). Those who flee are of three categories: Allah Almighty has described each one of them with a description. A category of them are those intending to flee to Allah Almighty, and they are: The Repentant, Regretful. The second: Are those walking the paths of fleeing to Allah Almighty, and they are: The Knowers (Gnostics), Confessors. And the third: Are those who arrived to Allah Almighty, and they are: The Pious (Muttaqun). Know that fleeing is of types: First: Fleeing from the world to the Master (Mawla). Second: Fleeing from Satan to the Master. Third: Fleeing from the self (Nafs) to the Master. Fourth: Fleeing from desire (Hawa) to the Master. Fifth: Fleeing from desires (Muna) to the Master. Sixth: Fleeing from the heart to the Master. Seventh: Fleeing from Allah to Allah. Abu al-Abbas said: Fleeing is four: Fleeing from creation, fleeing from the self, fleeing from the heart to Allah, and fleeing from Allah to Allah. All is gathered by (So flee). Sahl bin Abdullah said: So flee to Allah from Him, and from what is other than Allah to Allah. Sufyan said: So flee from ignorance of Allah to knowledge of Allah.

book_title: Solace of Sorrows to Avoid Sitting with Youths and Women
text: Yahya bin Mu'adh said: Our God, our bodies are captives of the world, and our hearts are captives of desire. Between that, we are taken by commands and prohibitions, wishing for purity for an hour of time, or to flee to Your door with sincerity for a moment of our lives, writing with tears the story of humility, and extending the hand of servitude to the glory of Lordship, but we are unable to do that. Here we are standing in the position of apology, confession, and drawing near (If You punish them, indeed they are Your servants; but if You forgive them, indeed it is You who is the Exalted in Might, the Wise). So upon you, O my brother, is truthfulness (Sidq) with Allah Almighty in what was mentioned and what will be mentioned. Truthfulness is the pillar of action, and truthfulness with Allah drives one to leave what Allah Almighty dislikes. Allah Almighty said: (O you who have believed, fear Allah and be with those who are true). The truthful are three: Truthful in his actions, truthful in his words, and truthful in his states. As for the truthful in his actions, he has six signs: Manifesting repentance, constant weeping, frequent humility, persistence in effort, correctness of observation (Muraqaba), and rushing to commands while avoiding prohibitions. The truthful in his states: has six signs: Asceticism in the world, giving when spending, altruism with necessity, good character, correctness of reliance (Tawakkul), and speaking the truth and knowing it. As for the truthful in his words: he has six signs: Standing before fear and hope, training the self with piety, certainty, performing gratitude, patience, observing modesty (Haya'), sincerity, acting with submission, and satisfaction with good manners on the carpet of openness (Inbisat). Abu Abdullah said: He was asked what is the best thing a servant directs to Allah? He said: Truthfulness, and the ugliest is lying. Yahya bin Mu'adh used to say in holding himself accountable: O you whom death is behind and hope is in front, nothing saves you but the truthfulness of action. Ahmad bin Hadrawayh said: Whoever wants Allah to be with him, let him stick to truthfulness. This speech was said by the verifiers (Muhaqqiqun) - may Allah be pleased with us and them and benefit us with their knowledge. Explanation of Intercourse with a Woman in her Anus, which is of the Major Sins: Allah Almighty said: (And they ask you about menstruation. Say, "It is harm, so keep away from wives during menstruation. And do not approach them until they are pure. And when they have purified themselves, then come to them from where Allah has ordained for you.") And Almighty said: (Your wives are a place of sowing of seed for you, so come to your place of cultivation however you wish). 'Al-Harth' (Tilth): Water (semen) is in the place of sowing. From Abu Hurayrah, may Allah be pleased with him, that the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said regarding the one who comes to a woman in her anus: "It is the lesser sodomy." From Ibn Abbas, may Allah be pleased with him, he said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Allah does not look at a man who came to a man or a woman in the anus."
