Narrated by Al-Tirmidhi and he said: A strange (Gharib) Hadith. And he, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Whoever comes to a menstruating woman or a woman in her anus or a soothsayer and believes him has disbelieved." He said: "And has disavowed what Allah revealed to Muhammad." Narrated by Abu Dawood and Al-Tirmidhi. Chapter: On the meaning of His saying (Your wives are a place of sowing of seed for you, so come to your place of cultivation however you wish). Meaning facing forward, backward, and lying down, meaning by that in the place of the child (vagina). These Hadiths are text on the permissibility of all states and positions if the tilth is in the place of sowing, which is the vagina, i.e., however you wish from behind and from front, kneeling or lying down, if he wishes crouching (Mujabbiyah), and if he wishes not crouching, that is in one valve (Simam). It is narrated "In one Sam" with Sin, said Al-Tirmidhi. Al-Nasa'i narrated from Abu Al-Nadr that he said to Nafi', the freed slave of Ibn Umar: It has been much said about you that you say on the authority of Ibn Umar that he gave a fatwa that women be approached in their anuses. Nafi' said: They have lied about me, but I will tell you how the matter was. Ibn Umar was reciting the Mushaf one day while I was with him until he reached (Your wives are a place of sowing of seed for you). Nafi' said: Do you know what the matter of this verse is? We, the people of Quraysh, used to make women crouch (Najbi). When we entered Medina and married the women of the Ansar, we wanted from them what we wanted from our women, but they disliked that and considered it grave. The women of the Ansar used to be approached only on their sides. So Allah revealed (Your wives are a place of sowing of seed for you). From Jabir, may Allah be pleased with him, that the Jews used to say: If a man comes to his wife from her rear into her front (vagina) then she conceives, her child will be cross-eyed. So (Your wives are a place of sowing of seed for you, so come to your place of cultivation however you wish) was revealed. He added in a narration from Al-Tirmidhi: "Meaning one valve." Narrated by Al-Bukhari and Muslim. From Abu Hurayrah, may Allah be pleased with him: "Whoever comes to women in their anuses and the man (homosexuality), then he is a disbeliever." And from him also: "Cursed is the one who comes to a woman in her anus." Umar bin Al-Khattab, may Allah be pleased with him, said: "Be shy of Allah, for Allah is not shy of the truth; do not come to women in their anuses." Explanation of the Prohibition of Approaching Women during Menstruation and the Permissibility of Enjoying them between the Navel and the Knee.

book_title: Solace of Sorrows to Avoid Sitting with Youths and Women
text: Allah Almighty said: (And they ask you about menstruation) (And do not approach them until they are pure. And when they have purified themselves) meaning with water, she performs Ghusl like the Ghusl (for impurities). He, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Do everything except intercourse." Consensus has been established on the prohibition of intercourse in the vagina. What is below the vagina is also forbidden, meaning the anus. Whoever deems it lawful disbelieves. Whoever has intercourse with his wife during menstruation gets a painful ailment. Allah Almighty said: (And they ask you about menstruation. Say, "It is harm") so He explained to them the harm resulting from it. As for expiation (Kaffarah) and discretionary punishment (Ta'zir), our Sheikh, may Allah have mercy on him, said: Know that intercourse in the vagina during menstruation is forbidden by the agreement of scholars. The doer of that sins and commits a major sin. The ruler punishes him with what he sees as a deterrent punishment, and no Hadd (prescribed punishment) or Kaffarah is obligatory on him. From Abu Hurayrah, may Allah be pleased with him: "Whoever has intercourse with a woman while she is menstruating and a child is decreed between them and he is afflicted with leprosy, let him blame no one but himself." In the old school (of Shafi'i), if he has intercourse at the time of its weakness (end of period), he must give half a Dinar in charity. As for enjoyment between the navel and the knee, there are two views. One is that it is forbidden, which is intercourse. If he touches above the navel and below the knee, it is permissible. If he enjoys the navel and knee themselves, Al-Nawawi said: The chosen view is its permissibility. It is forbidden to sleep with her in one quilt without enjoyment between the navel and the knee, and this is if she is wrapped in a waistcloth. Explanation of the Prohibition of Lesbianism (Sihaq) among Women: It is among the major sins, which is a woman coming to a woman. From Wathilah bin Al-Asqa', he said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Sihaq is the adultery of women among themselves." He, peace and blessings be upon him, also said: "The Awrah of a woman to a woman is like the Awrah of a man to a man." He also said: "No woman shall touch another woman unless they are two adulteresses." He also said: "Three, Allah does not accept from them the saying 'La ilaha illa Allah': The mounter and the mounted (male), the mounter and the mounted (female), and the unjust Imam." Ali, may Allah be pleased with him, said: "If men satisfy themselves with men and women with women, then swallowing (by earth), transformation, and bombardment from the sky will occur." Ata' said: From Abu Hurayrah, may Allah be pleased with him, who said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "A time will come upon people when boys are married and women are not married, and jealousy is shown over boys as it is shown over women." In this sin is discretionary punishment (Ta'zir) according to what deters its doer. Sheikh Taqi al-Din al-Hisni, may Allah have mercy on him, said in the explanation of Abu Shuja's book: Lesbianism of women for women is forbidden and they are punished for it because it is a forbidden act. Judge Abu al-Tayyib, may Allah have mercy on him, said: Its sin is like the sin of adultery because of his saying, peace and blessings be upon him: "If a woman comes to a woman, they are two adulteresses." In the tradition: If a woman mounts a woman, Allah Almighty commands an angel to place upon her seventy cloaks of fire and a shield of fire. Explanation of Effeminacy (Takhannuth) in Men and What it Entails: The meaning of Takhannuth is: A man resembling a woman in her speech, dress, and all her states. It is among the major sins necessitating cursing for resembling a woman. Likewise, a woman resembling a man, based on the Hadith. Ibn Abbas, may Allah be pleased with him, said: "The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, cursed the effeminate men and the masculine women." It is an authentic Hadith. Abu Hurayrah, may Allah be pleased with him, said: "The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, cursed the man who wears the clothing of a woman, and the woman who wears the clothing of a man." Narrated by Abu Dawood with an authentic chain. He, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Two types of the people of Hellfire I have not seen: A people with whips like the tails of cows beating the people with them, and women who are clothed yet naked, inclining and inclined, their heads like the humps of Bukht camels leaning. They will not enter Paradise nor smell its fragrance, although its fragrance can be found from such and such distance." Narrated by Muslim in his Sahih.

book_title: Solace of Sorrows to Avoid Sitting with Youths and Women
text: "Notice" The affliction has become general in our time with what is more severe than that, which is that a woman puts on her head something called "Taqiyah" and "Qubba'ah" so it becomes like a plate or a minaret. On the head of some of them is something resembling a small waterskin. Perhaps these caps are wrapped with handkerchiefs until they become like a turban, so she enters into resembling men. Thus, the threat of the Hadith applies to her as well. This results in shortening the waist-wrapper and tucking it up contrary to custom due to the height of this calamity she placed on her head, so that her clothes, slippers, and dress are revealed from under the waist-wrapper. As for his saying, peace and blessings be upon him: "Clothed yet naked": There is disagreement on the saying: Clothed yet naked. It was said: Clothed in Allah's blessings, naked of gratitude for them. It was said: They wear thin clothes that describe the skin. He, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Verily, men perished when they obeyed women." Sa'id bin al-Musayyib, may Allah have mercy on him, narrated from Umar bin al-Khattab, may Allah be pleased with him: "Four walk while Allah is angry with them: Those men resembling women, those women resembling men, he who mates with an animal, and he who does the deed of the people of Lot." It is mentioned from Ibn Abbas, may Allah be pleased with him, that he said: "The Messenger of Allah cursed the house which effeminate men enter." And from him also that the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, "cursed the effeminate men and the masculine women." He said: "Expel them from your houses, so expel so-and-so and so-and-so." Ahmad and Ishaq, may Allah have mercy on them, stated the banishment of the effeminate. "Notice" On the Prohibition of Associating with Youths and Looking at Them. Abu Zakariya al-Nawawi said in his Fatawa: "Question" Is looking at a beardless boy (Amrad) lawful or not? If a man loves beardless boys, spends his money on them, and it is easy for him to give one of them a large sum, but difficult for him to give a dirham to a poor needy man with a family, is his meeting with them and spending in this way forbidden for him? And if he gathers them, is he sinful or not? Does the probity (Adalah) of one who gathers them and persists in that drop or not? Did any scholar say this is permissible or not? The Answer: Mere looking at a beautiful beardless boy is forbidden whether with desire or otherwise, unless there is a legal need like buying, medical treatment, teaching, etc. Then the amount of need is permissible, and excess is forbidden. Allah Almighty said: (Tell the believing men to reduce [some] of their vision). He, may Allah Almighty have mercy on him, and other scholars, may Allah have mercy on them, stated the prohibition of looking at him without a legal need. They argued with the noble verse, and that he is in the meaning of a woman, rather some of them are more beautiful than many women. And because what is possible regarding a woman and facilitated by way of marriage and legal intercourse is not facilitated regarding him, so he is (more worthy of) prohibition. The sayings of the Salaf in alienating from them and warning against seeing them are more than can be counted. They called them "The Stinking Ones" (Al-Antan); because they are filthy legally. Whether what we mentioned is the look of one attributed to righteousness or otherwise. As for being alone (Khalwah) with a beardless boy, it is more severely forbidden than looking at him because it is more obscene and closer to evil, whether one attributed to righteousness is alone with him or otherwise. As for gathering beardless boys in the mentioned manner, it is forbidden for the gatherer and the attendee. Spending money on that is forbidden, strictly forbidden. Whoever gathers them and persists becomes a sinner (Fasiq), his testimony is rejected, and his guardianship drops. The guardian of the beardless boy - may Allah guide him - must prevent them from that. Every responsible person (Mukallaf) who knows the state of these people must denounce them according to his ability. Whoever is unable to denounce them but can raise their case to the ruler must do so. None of the scholars, may Allah Almighty have mercy on them, said this is permissible in this manner. Chapter: On Hope and Fear.

book_title: Solace of Sorrows to Avoid Sitting with Youths and Women
text: Our Sheikh said in his book 'Tuhfat al-Abrar': Know that whoever prepares something hoping to obtain it is called hopeful (Raji). Likewise, whoever obeys Allah hoping for acceptance or repents hoping for forgiveness. As for whoever persists in negligence and hopes for His forgiveness, he is deluded, not hopeful. He, peace be upon him, said: "The wise is he who holds himself accountable and works for what is after death, and the incapable is he who follows his self's desires and wishes [vain] wishes upon Allah." As for fear, it is the expectation of a felony [punishment]. Every favored person should be fearful of punishment, and it may occur from precedence (past decree) or from the conclusion (end of life). A believer must have fear. Al-Darami said: Every heart that has no fear in it is ruined. Fear may lead to anxiety and weeping. The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, used to pray while a sound like the boiling of a pot came from his chest. He, peace be upon him, said: "When I was taken on the Night Journey, I saw Gabriel, peace be upon him, like a worn-out saddlecloth thrown down out of fear of Allah Almighty." Abu Bakr Al-Siddiq, may Allah be pleased with him, used to say: "Would that I were a tree cut down and not eaten." Umar, may Allah be pleased with him, passed by a straw and said: Would that I were this straw. Ali said on the Day of the Camel: "I wish I had died twenty years before this day." Abu Ubaidah said: "I would have liked to be a ram, slaughtered by my family, who ate my meat and drank my broth." Ibn Mas'ud said: "If I stood between Paradise and Hell and was given the choice between them or becoming dust, I would choose to be dust." Imran bin Husain said: "Would that I were ashes scattered by the winds." Aisha, may Allah be pleased with her, said: "Would that I were a thing forgotten and unnoticed." The fear of the Salaf and their weeping is famous. Yazid bin Hawshab said: I have not seen anyone more fearful than Al-Hasan and Umar bin Abd al-Aziz, as if Hell was not created except for them. The Knowers said: A servant must have equal fear and hope while in good health. In sickness, his hope should be [dominant]. In the state of falling into sin, he should be fearful, for it is more helpful in repelling sin. Know, O my brother, that if the heart is devoid of fear, it is ruined. Fear is a driver that drives and hinders: it drives to obedience and hinders from disobedience. My master Abd al-Aziz al-Dirini said: Fear has meanings: fear of Fire, fear of ruin, fear of precedence (decree), and fear of the conclusion (Khatimah). We ask Allah Almighty for a good conclusion. Chapter: Explanation of Sins. Sheikh Abd al-Aziz, may Allah have mercy on him, said: Know that sins are of two types: abandoning an obligation and committing a prohibition.

book_title: Solace of Sorrows to Avoid Sitting with Youths and Women
text: The first of them - the sin of Iblis, for it is abandoning an obligation. He was commanded to prostrate, but he did not prostrate. And the sin of Adam, he was forbidden from eating from the tree, but he ate. Then it is divided into what is the right of Allah, and what is the right of a human. Then it is divided in terms of its origins into four sections: Lordly (Rububiyyah), Satanic (Shaytoniyyah), Bestial (Bahimiyyah), and Predatory (Sab'iyyah). Lordly: Resembling the attributes of the Lord, Glory be to Him. So whoever among creation resembles them by being arrogant, tyrannical, seeking elevation, loftiness, praise, and dominance over creation, has disputed Lordship its right. Satanic: Resembling Satan. Among his attributes are envy, transgression, trickery, deception, cheating, hypocrisy, and calling to sins, innovations, and misguidance. Bestial: Lust and greed to satisfy the desire of the stomach and genitals. From it branch out adultery, theft, eating the orphan's money, and gathering unlawful wealth to satisfy desires. Predatory: Anger and hatred. From it branch out arrogance, beating, and harming creation. The first thing that dominates man is the Bestial. When he grows and his understanding increases, the Predatory enters him. If his thinking strengthens and he is not guided, he uses his mind in plotting, deception, and Satanic attributes. Then disputing Lordship enters him. Allah, the Mighty and Majestic, said: (Pride is My cloak and Greatness is My lower garment, so whoever disputes with Me in one of them, I will throw him into the Fire). End of the words of my master Abd al-Aziz. Ibn al-Qayyim said: Imam Ahmad mentioned from Wahb: That the Lord, Blessed and Exalted, said in some of what He says to the Children of Israel: "Indeed, if I am obeyed I am pleased, and if I am pleased I bless, and there is no end to My blessing. And if I am disobeyed I get angry, and if I get angry I curse, and My curse reaches the seventh child." Abu Nu'aym mentioned from Salim bin Abi al-Ja'd: A person might find the hearts of believers cursing him from where he does not perceive. Then he said: Do you know why this is? I said: No. He said: The servant secludes himself with sins against Allah, so Allah casts hatred for him into the hearts of believers from where he does not perceive. He also mentioned from Waki', Zakariya bin Amir told us, he said: Aisha, may Allah be pleased with her, wrote to Muawiyah, may Allah be pleased with him: As for what follows... If a servant commits a sin, his praiser among people turns into a blamer. Abdullah son of Imam Ahmad mentioned in his book 'Al-Zuhd' for his father from Muhammad bin Sirin that when debt overwhelmed him, he was distressed by that and said: I know this distress is due to a sin I committed forty years ago. Here is a subtle point where people err regarding sin: They do not see its effect immediately, and its effect may be delayed so it is forgotten, and the servant thinks that it will not change after that, and that the matter is as the poet said: If you do not change a wall when it falls... It has no dust after falling. Glory be to Allah! How many creatures has this calamity destroyed, how many blessings has it removed, how many vengeances has it brought! How many are deluded by it, let alone the ignorant! He did not know that sin breaks down even after a while, just as poison breaks down, and just as a wound healed over corruption and bad matter breaks down. End of Ibn al-Qayyim's words. Chapter: On Incidents that Occurred in the Author's Time.

book_title: Solace of Sorrows to Avoid Sitting with Youths and Women
text: My master Abd al-Aziz al-Dirini, may Allah have mercy on him, said in his book 'Al-Rawdah Al-Aniqa': Chapter on incidents that occurred in our time: Know that what called for writing this summary is that a people in this time innovated a path contrary to the path of the [righteous] people, claiming they have good intentions in it. Among them: Seclusion with women, talking with them, and some perhaps added hugging, kissing, and touching with foreign women (non-Mahram). Others followed a similar path with youths. This is not hidden from a person of intellect as being from Satan's tricks and plots, and his snares and traps. Allah, the Mighty and Majestic, said addressing the Companions of the Messenger, peace and blessings be upon him - despite their rank - regarding the wives of the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him - despite their rank as Mothers of Believers in sanctity and prohibition, nay greater than them in reverence and honor - (And when you ask them for something, ask them from behind a partition. That is purer for your hearts and their hearts). So whoever claims he is stronger in faith than the Companions, or that the women he secludes with are purer in heart and more self-controlled than the wives of the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, has magnified fabrication and increased audacity regarding the Hadith of seclusion alone, so how about what exceeds that? In the Hadith, the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, was performing I'tikaf in Ramadan when his wife Hafsa bint Umar entered upon him. She spoke with him for an hour then went out. He saw two men on the road and said: She is your mother Hafsa. They said: Glory be to Allah, O Messenger of Allah! He said: "Indeed Satan flows through the son of Adam like blood, and I feared he might cast something into your hearts." If the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, feared Satan would cast into people's souls that a foreign woman was with him, how can anyone else be safe from people suspecting him?! It was narrated from the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, that he said: "Do not be alone with a woman even if you teach her the Quran." It was narrated that women gathered around him asking to pledge allegiance by hand. He said: My hand does not touch the hand of a woman, but my saying to one woman is like my saying to a hundred women. So he pledged allegiance to them by speech without touching. It was narrated that when they asked for "Blessing", he put his hand in water then transferred it to them, and they put their hands in it. If the Master of the first and last avoided these matters, and others rush into what is greater than them, how can the ugliness of what they undertake be hidden from a sane person? We ask Allah for safety by His grace and generosity. Greater than that is their denial of those who avoid these ugly acts, saying: "You are weak of heart." Nothing is weak but their faith. And their saying: "Nothing harms the Faqir (Sufi/Poor one)." This is false, for prohibitions are not specific to one without another. If they meant the Faqir does not fall into sin, they have lied, for these things are sins in themselves. So how can it be said to one who disobeyed that he did not disobey? If they meant by change that Allah's blessing on him or the succession of lights and unveiling to him [continues], this is a great error. For openings (Futuhat), miracles (Karamat), and good times are only a sign of nearness if their owner is upright on the path of verification. As for their appearance with confusion and violation of Sharia, it is a sign of plotting and Istidraj (gradual lure) as Allah Almighty said: (We will progressively lead them from where they do not know). As for their saying: Some women and youths have the intention of acquiring knowledge or etiquette (Adab), and if all people avoided associating with women and youths, none of them would acquire knowledge or etiquette. The answer is that teaching and discipline is specific to the knowing scholars. So how can one who has no knowledge or gnosis intend to teach others? This is a great rank not suitable except for those firmly grounded in knowledge and gnosis. Then, even for one suitable for this, it is not lawful for him to increase the meeting with women and youths beyond what need calls for. That is, the meeting should not be in seclusion, nor with openness and joy, but he should speak only in seriousness, firmness, admonition, and knowledge. He should not prolong the look, and if able, not look at all. I saw some of our knowing scholar Sheikhs habituate himself to lower his gaze from men, and it became a habit for him which he did not have to force with women. There was kinship between him and women near us, so he used to visit them to uphold ties of kinship, and I was with him. He would stand at the door of the house until the woman came out to him, greet her from afar, lower his gaze, and leave. So how can one be safe who enters their husbands' houses without permission, eats their food, then becomes informal, goes out, opens his eyes, and extends his hands? Perhaps he adds more than this. It is reported in the Sahih: "The eyes, their adultery is looking; the ears, their adultery is listening; and the hands, their adultery is touching." All these actions are adultery. Is adultery lawful with a good intention? Are intentions considered in prohibitions? The Hadith was narrated regarding permissible acts and obediences. For the permissible, if done with a good intention, becomes obedience. And obedience, if there is no sincerity of intention for Allah in it, is showing off (Riya'). This is the meaning of the saying of

The Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him: "Actions are by intentions." As for prohibitions, they are sins, and if one intends a good intention by them, he is an ignorant sinner. Chapter: On False Claims. A group increased and claimed that their meeting with women and youths, and engaging in these matters, brings blessing, and that the proximity of a woman and a youth to a righteous man is a cause for the life of the heart, for light flows from heart to heart, and similar false adornments! These are a group who resembled devils, for Satan beautifies impossible things with prohibited matters and adorns them with false images. This is a trick of debauchery, a trick of plotting, and a deceit of lying. Would that these people, since they fell into these uglinesses, did not add to them what is uglier; for the one who knows and confesses his sin is lighter in sin and less in crime. Whoever has a wife must deter these people with a healing punishment and sufficient restraint. If he cannot do that, let him forbid them sufficiently. If they do not accept, denouncing them with the heart becomes obligatory, as the Almighty said: (Leave them to eat and enjoy themselves and be diverted by hope, for they are going to know). End. Chapter: On Enjoining Good and Forbidding Evil. Allah Almighty said: (And let there be [arising] from you a nation inviting to [all that is] good, enjoining what is right and forbidding what is wrong, and those will be the successful). Allah, Glory be to Him and Exalted, commanded in this verse explicitly to enjoin good and forbid evil. He praised in another verse those who enjoin good and forbid evil, saying: (You were the best nation produced for mankind). He said in the verse describing the believers: (Enjoining what is right and forbidding what is wrong). In the Hadith: "You will surely enjoin good and forbid evil, and you will surely take the hand of the oppressor, and you will surely bend him to the truth bending, and you will surely restrict him to the truth restricting, or Allah will surely strike the hearts of some of you against others, then He will surely curse you as He cursed them." Narrated by Abu Dawood. In the Hadith also: "Whoever among you sees an evil, let him change it with his hand; if he cannot, then with his tongue; if he cannot, then with his heart, and that is the weakest of faith." From Hudhayfah bin Al-Yaman that the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "By the One in Whose hand is my soul, you will surely enjoin good and forbid evil, or else Allah will soon send upon you a punishment, then you will call upon Him and He will not answer you." So the Book and the Sunnah established the obligation of enjoining good and forbidding evil, and the Hadiths on that are many. Scholars said: Allah Almighty made enjoining good and forbidding evil a distinction between believers and hypocrites because Allah Almighty said: (The hypocrite men and hypocrite women are of one another. They enjoin what is wrong and forbid what is right). And the Almighty said: (The believing men and believing women are allies of one another. They enjoin what is right and forbid what is wrong). Thus it is established that the most specific characteristic of believers and the strongest indication of the soundness of their belief and the safety of their secrets is enjoining good and forbidding evil. However, this is not something suitable for everyone, nor obligatory on everyone. Rather, it is one of the duties that the Sultan should perform for Muslims if the establishment of Hadd punishments is up to him, and discretionary punishment is entrusted to his opinion. So he appoints in every city and every village a righteous man, strong in faith, knowledgeable, and orders him to observe the conditions that occur. So he sees no evil and hears no evil except that he changes it, and leaves no good needing to be ordered except that he orders it. Whenever a Hadd is obligatory on a sinner, he establishes it and does not suspend it, for nothing is more disgracing to corruptors than establishing Allah's Hadd upon them. He should not exceed what is legislated, as the One who legislated it is more knowledgeable about the way of governing them. Every Muslim scholar who combines the virtue of knowledge and the righteousness of Muslims who combine the virtue of knowledge and righteousness of action, must call to good and deter from evil. If he is capable of nullifying the evil and repelling it and deterring the one demanding it when doing it... If he is not capable himself, but another is capable, then that is for the Sultan not anyone else. If he is not capable except of speech, he must order with the tongue. If he is not capable except of denial with the heart, he denies it. Enjoining good in this is like forbidding evil. If the reforming scholar has room to call to it and order it, he does so. If he is only capable of speech... Who Undertakes Enjoining Good and Forbidding Evil:

book_title: Solace of Sorrows to Avoid Sitting with Youths and Women
text: Imam Al-Halimi said: The one enjoining good and forbidding evil should be discerning, gentle where gentleness is needed, harsh where harshness is needed, speaking to every class of people with what he knows because it is more suitable for them and more listened to among them. He should be unbiased and not compromising. He should reform himself first and rectify it, then turn to reforming and rectifying others. Allah Almighty said: (Do you order righteousness of the people and forget yourselves?). From Muhammad bin Al-Nadr, he said: A man was mentioned in the presence of Al-Rabi' bin Khuthaym. He said: I am not pleased with myself so that I may be free from blaming it to blaming others. Indeed, people feared Allah regarding the sins of others and felt safe from Him regarding their own sins. The Sultan Who Commits Immoralities and the Function of Enjoining Good and Forbidding Evil. Al-Halimi said: The Sultan who commits immoralities enjoins good and forbids evil; because authority is based on this. If he withdrew from it, he would not be a Sultan. No one below him is like him in this; because undertaking this matter is only abandoned by withholding the Sultan from it for his knowledge and righteousness. If he chose his own righteousness, he became deserving of change, so he would not be a changer of others with that. In Al-Bayhaqi from Abu Hurayrah, may Allah be pleased with him, he said: O Messenger of Allah, by Allah, unless you enjoin good and forbid evil until there remains nothing of good but you ordered us with it, and nothing of evil but you forbade us from it, we will not enjoin anyone with good nor forbid anyone from evil. The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said to us: "Enjoin good even if you do not do all of it, and forbid evil even if you do not desist from all of it." Al-Hasan Al-Basri said: Satan wants you to not achieve this trait, which is that you do not enjoin good until you do all of it, meaning this leads to cutting off the door of Hisbah (accountability). Who is immune from sins? From Ibn Abbas, may Allah be pleased with them both, that a man came to him and said: O Ibn Abbas, I want to enjoin good and forbid evil. He said: Have you reached that? He said: I hope so. He said: If you are not good at opening with three letters from the Book of Allah Almighty: (Do you order righteousness of the people) the verse. Have you mastered this verse? He said: No. He said: The second letter is His Almighty's saying: (Why do you say what you do not do) the verse. Have you mastered this verse? He said: No. He said: The third letter. He said: The saying of the righteous servant: (And I do not intend to differ from you in that which I have forbidden you) the verse. Have you mastered this verse? He said: No. He said: Then start with yourself! Explanation of Who Left Enjoining Good and Forbidding Evil due to Corruption. From Al-Nu'man bin Bashir, he said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "The likeness of the one abiding by Allah's limits and the one compromising in them is like a people who drew lots for a ship. Some of them got the lower part and some of them got the upper part. Those in the lower part used to fetch water passing by those in the upper part, so they passed by them and annoyed them. Those in the upper part said: You annoyed us by pouring water on us. So they took an axe and started making a hole in the ship. Those in the upper part said: What are you doing?! If they leave them and what they intend, they will all drown. And if they take their hands (stop them), they will all be saved." Narrated by Al-Bukhari in his Sahih. Al-Bayhaqi narrated from Abu Umamah, he said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "The best Jihad is a word of truth before an unjust Sultan." And for him from Abu Dharr, and in it: "And he advised me to speak the truth even if it was bitter." From Hudhayfah, he said: "Islam is eight shares: Islam is a share, prayer is a share, Zakah is a share, fasting Ramadan is a share, Hajj is a share, Jihad is a share, enjoining good is a share, and forbidding evil is a share. Whoever has no share has failed." From Jabir, the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Allah revealed to Gabriel, peace be upon him, to overturn such and such city with its people. He said: He said: O Lord, indeed among them is Your servant so-and-so who did not disobey You for the blink of an eye. He said: Overturn it on him and on them, for his face never changed color (in anger) for Me for an hour." From Malik bin Fadalah, he said: We agreed on the love of the world, so none of us enjoins another, nor does any of us forbid another, and Allah Almighty will not leave this on this state. I wish I knew what punishment will descend! From Ibn Abbas regarding His Almighty's saying: (And if not for Allah checking the people some of them by means of others), he said: "Checking by the one who prays for the one who does not pray, and by the one who performs Hajj for the one who does not perform Hajj, and by the one who pays Zakah for the one who does not pay Zakah." From Bilal bin Sa'd, he said: "Indeed, sin if hidden harms only its doer, and if announced and not changed, harms the general public." He said: "Indeed, it is from your negligence of yourself and your turning away from Allah Almighty that you see what angers Allah and you overlook it, neither enjoining nor forbidding regarding it, out of fear of what possesses neither harm nor benefit for you." He said: "Whoever leaves enjoining good and forbidding evil out of fear of creatures, obedience is stripped from him. Even if he orders his child or some of his clients, they would not value his right."

book_title: Solace of Sorrows to Avoid Sitting with Youths and Women
text: Abu Bakr Al-Siddiq, may Allah be pleased with him, said in his sermon: O people, you read this verse and interpret it contrary to its interpretation (O you who have believed, upon you is yourselves. Those who have gone astray will not harm you when you have been guided). I heard the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, say: "There are no people who commit sins, and among them is one who can denounce them but does not do so, except that Allah is about to encompass them with a punishment from Him." Aisha, may Allah be pleased with her, said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "The people of a village containing eighteen thousand whose deeds were like the deeds of prophets were punished. They said: O Messenger of Allah, how is that? He said: They did not get angry for the sake of Allah Almighty, nor did they enjoin good nor forbid evil." Al-Ghazali, may Allah have mercy on him, said: Everyone who witnesses an evil and does not change it, nor denounce it, and remains silent about it, is a partner in it. The listener is a partner of the backbiter. This applies to all sins, even sitting with one who wears brocade, wears gold rings, sits on silk, sitting in a house or bath with images on its walls or vessels of gold or silver, sitting in a mosque where people pray badly not completing bowing and prostration, sitting in a preaching gathering where innovation is mentioned, or in a debate or argument gathering where harm and obscenity occur through foolishness and insults. In summary, whoever mixes with people, his sins increase even if he is pious in himself, unless he abandons compromise, is not seized by the blame of a blamer for the sake of Allah, and occupies himself with good deeds and preventing evil. The obligation only drops from him by one of two things: First: That he knows that if he denounces, he will not be paid attention to, the evil will not be abandoned, and he will be looked at with the eye of mockery. This is common in evils committed by jurists (Fuqaha) and those who claim to be people of religion. Here silence is permissible, but rebuking with the tongue is recommended to show the rites of religion for one who cannot do other than rebuking with the tongue. He must leave that place, for it is not permissible to witness sin by choice. Whoever sits in a gathering of drinking is a sinner even if he does not drink. Whoever sits with a backbiter, or wearer of silk, or eater of usury or haram is a sinner, so let him stand from his place. Second: That he knows he can prevent the evil, like seeing a bottle with wine and throwing it to break it, or snatching a musical instrument from its owner's hand and striking it on the ground, but he knows he will be beaten or suffer harm. Here Hisbah (accountability) is recommended due to the Almighty's saying: (And forbid what is wrong and be patient over what befalls you). It is not obligatory unless the harm that befalls him has many degrees requiring long consideration mentioned by Al-Ghazali in Ihya' in the Book of Enjoining Good. In summary, the obligation does not drop except by harm to his body by beating, or to his wealth by destruction, or to his status by disparaging him in a way that impugns his chivalry. As for fear of obscenity of the denier against him, fear of his exposure to him with the tongue, his enmity to him, or creating illusion of his striving in the future with what displeases him, and intervening between him and an increase of good he awaits; all these are illusions and weak matters by which obligation does not drop. Know that the pillar of Hisbah is two things: First: Kindness and gentleness, and starting with admonition by way of religion, not by way of violence, arrogance, and showing off with the sign of righteousness. For that confirms the motive for sin, and incites the sinners to denial and harm. Then if he harms him and he is not of good character, he gets angry for himself, and the denial for the sake of Allah Almighty is rejected, and he busies himself with healing his anger from him, so he becomes a sinner. Rather, he should be hating of the Hisbah, wishing the sinner would leave the sin by someone else's word. If he loves to be the objector, that is because of what is in his soul of the state of seeking accountability. From him, he said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "No one enjoins good nor forbids evil except one who is gentle in what he enjoins, gentle in what he forbids, forbearing in what he enjoins, forbearing in what he forbids, knowledgeable in what he enjoins, knowledgeable in what he forbids." A preacher admonished Al-Ma'mun violently, so he said: O man; be gentle, for He sent one better than you to one worse than me, and commanded him with gentleness, so He Almighty said: (And speak to him with gentle speech that perhaps he may be reminded or fear). Abu Umamah narrated that a young man came to the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, and said: Do you give me permission to commit adultery? The people shouted at him. The Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Bring him near, come close to me." So he came close to him. He, peace and blessings be upon him, said: Do you like it for your mother? He said: No - may Allah make me your ransom. He said: Likewise people do not like it for their mothers. Then he, peace and blessings be upon him, said: Do you like it for your daughter? He said: No. He said: Likewise people do not like it for their daughters. Until he mentioned to him the sister, the paternal aunt, and the maternal aunt, saying: Likewise people do not like it. Then he placed his hand on his chest and said: O Allah, purify him, forgive his sin, and guard his chastity. After that, there was nothing

The Second Pillar: That the Muhtasib (accountability seeker) has started with himself, refined it, and left what he forbids first.
