The Second Pillar: That the Muhtasib (accountability seeker) has started with himself, refined it, and left what he forbids first. Al-Hasan Al-Basri, may Allah have mercy on him, said: If you enjoin good, be the most diligent of people in it, otherwise you will perish. This is better so his words benefit, otherwise he will be mocked. This is not a condition (doubt?), but accountability is permissible for the sinner as well. Explanation of the harm of one who enjoins good and forbids evil but does not desist. From Usama bin Zaid, he said: I heard the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, say: "A man will be brought on the Day of Resurrection and thrown into the Fire, so his intestines will spill out, and he will go around with them in the Fire as a donkey goes around its millstone. The people of the Fire will gather around him and say: O So-and-so, what is the matter with you? What happened to you? Were you not enjoining us with good and forbidding us from evil! He will say: Yes, I used to enjoin you with good but not do it, and forbid you from evil but do it." Al-Bayhaqi brought out from Anas, he said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "The believers are sincere to one another, loving each other even if their dwellings and bodies are far apart. And the wicked are cheating one another, abandoning one another even if their dwellings and bodies are close together." "Notices" First: The one enjoining good should be knowledgeable about the differences of scholars in what he enjoins and forbids. Second: If he is only capable with the heart, let him say at his denial: O Allah, this is an evil I do not approve of, three times. Let him pray for him at that time for repentance, and turn his face away from him in denial of his action, not in rebuke and revenge. Beware of that; for Sheikh Abu Al-Hasan, may Allah have mercy on him, said: Honor the believers even if they are immoral sinners. Enjoin them with good and forbid them from evil, and desert them out of mercy for them. Do not restrict/estimate against them.

book_title: Solace of Sorrows to Avoid Sitting with Youths and Women
text: He, may Allah be pleased with him, said: If the light of the disobedient believer were unveiled, it would fill what is between the heavens and the earth, so what is your thought about the light of the obedient believer? "Notice" And be safe, O fool, O ignorant, O wicked, O foolish one, from standing for yourself in the face of the one enjoining good and forbidding evil, and attacking him and getting angry, to harm yourself, or for a limb of yours to change. You would be a hypocrite by that, denying the command and prohibition; rather you would be a stubborn tyrant. For you measure yourself against him, so you deny his command, and you do not know that he is an agent for you in commanding and forbidding on behalf of Allah and His Messenger. Rather, you should recognize his right in reverence, dignity, submission, humbleness before him, and accepting his command with hearing and obedience. Rather, hasten to sincere repentance, returning to Allah, and regret. Whenever you do contrary to that, hatred will befall you and you will not find for yourself a protector or a helper. Know that Allah is the protector of the one standing for the truth, commanding [good], forbidding falsehood, and his supporter due to His saying: (O you who have believed, if you support Allah, He will support you). So you must recognize his right at the time of the command, and rectify your excess in the hour he commands you, for fear that Satan shows you anger against the one commanding you. Know the value of his status, for he has the sanctity of standing for Allah and His Messenger, and the sanctity of jealousy for Allah, and anger for Him. These are sanctities understood only by one whom Allah wants good for, and return to Him. Do you not see the one standing at the door of the Sultan or the door of the governor of your city, commanding you with something not related to religion, but a worldly matter, either to take your money, or harm you in your child or dependents; are you able to oppose him, or able to deny his command and prohibition?! So how about one who speaks on the tongue of the Greatest Messenger, and about the command of the King of Kings?! How can he be opposed? That is only due to the greatness of your heedlessness of Allah and the greatness of your calamity! Look at the sanctity of a creature, and your speed in answering him with hearing and obedience, and look at your opposition to the one speaking for the King of Kings, your attack on him, and your denial of his command and prohibition. So beware of the density of your self and the heedlessness of your heart. Know the rights of those who stand for Allah and His Messenger. Were it not for that, calamity would have befallen creation; i.e., were it not for the one standing for Allah, commanding, forbidding, advising creation, admonishing them, and counseling each other, what only Allah knows would have befallen them. So we ask Allah for pardon and well-being, and that He grants us success for His obedience, and keeps us away from His disobedience. He is the Guardian of success. May Allah bless our master Muhammad, his family, and his companions and grant peace. Chapter: On What Should be in the Gathering of Preaching. The gathering of preaching should not be devoid of deterrence from sins. Sheikh Abu Al-Faraj Ibn Al-Jawzi said: And what contains deterrence from sins. I contemplated this regarding myself, and I saw many of my gatherings passing between interpreting a verse, mentioning a report and stories of the righteous, and the horrors of the Resurrection. All that is good, except that due to the soundness of my heart, I did not believe there were many sins and immoralities among Muslims! I hardly mentioned the prohibition of adultery and the like. So I thought and saw the priority is that the bulk of the gathering be on this, for most of them are commoners, and these ills are widespread among them. So what does the standing of "Sari" all night benefit them, and the hunger of "Bishr Al-Hafi", and the asceticism of "Malik bin Dinar"? Even if mentioning that contains a type of rebuke for the negligent. But the most important is that he should follow a path where the generality of the gathering is on frightening about the consequences of sins and strictness in forbidding them. No gathering is free of a wine drinker, a dealer in usury, and one eager for adultery. Then we mention a condition of it also in observing the obligations of the pillars of prayer, Zakat, and others. Then point in the end to the states of the righteous; for every people has a drink. If this is established, he must avoid leadership, and be good to his wife and children in expanding provision, for expanding provision increases life span, and connects the womb (kinship). For the womb (Rahim) clings to the Throne and says: "I am the Rahim, whoever connects me, Allah connects him, and whoever cuts me, Allah cuts him." In a narration: A branch from the Rahman. Allah, the Mighty and Majestic, said: "I will surely connect whoever connects you and cut whoever cuts you." So you must change what you deny, and deny what necessitates denial. The Way of the Scholar in Changing Evil:

book_title: Solace of Sorrows to Avoid Sitting with Youths and Women
text: Know that the scholar's way in changing evil is to speak about it from what Allah taught him by way of admonition in his gatherings or away from gatherings, mentioning the ruling. If he is listened to and returns, the goal is achieved, his word engaged his heart, he established his excuse with Allah, and performed what was obligatory upon him. He is also safe from the great calamity upon him in not speaking; for it is reported "that on the Day of Resurrection a man will cling to another man who does not know him and say: What is the matter with you? I never saw you. He will say to him: Yes, you saw me one day on an evil and did not forbid me from it." This is a dangerous matter before safety from it occurs. By speaking, he escapes this danger. He only leaves it while seeing it due to the souls' familiarity with it, and that destroyed those who passed of nations. It is reported "that Moses, peace be upon him, passed by a village that Allah Almighty had destroyed. He said: O Lord, how did You destroy them when I knew a righteous man among them? Allah Almighty revealed to him, O Moses: 'He did not have Ghayrah (jealousy/anger) for Me.'" This report benefitted us that if he had changed upon them, he would not have perished, nor would they. The ruling in that is he is rewarded for changing upon them and denying, just as you are commanded to leave what they innovated. When they fell into opposition and he remained silent, it was a falling from him into what they are in, because he committed what was forbidden of silence upon seeing opposition. So he became equal with them in committing the forbidden. There was no one in the village then to lift the affliction from them when it descended upon them, because punishment is only lifted by compliance, and there was no compliant one then, so what happened happened. Here it is today, no doubt and no hiding in the occurrence of this matter due to the occurrence of what occurs and the silence of our scholars in the gathering; they do not speak upon seeing it nor urge in their gatherings of knowledge to leave it. So undoubtedly, the descent of all causes of punishment is continuous in my view mostly, except for whom Allah protected. Chapter: On Matters People take Lightly and from which Calamity Comes. Some people take lightly matters: Boys Entering Houses: Among them is that a boy enters the houses of some of them to fulfill their needs, and eats and drinks with them, among his women and daughters, until his beard grows, and he is in that state. Someone with knowledge says to him: The entry of this adult youth upon you has become forbidden! The man and woman say: This one was raised with us and among our children, he is like one of them, and we know nothing but good of him. They did not deny this great calamity! Entry of Neighborhood Sons and Neighbors' Sons! Likewise, if there is a youth entering upon them and he says: He is the son of our neighborhood, and the son of our neighbors, and they did not deny that. Most corruption happens from this calamity. The Jurist Teacher Sending Some Boys to His House: Likewise, the jurist teacher sends some of his boys to his house to fulfill his need; he enters upon his wife and daughters and continues on that until he reaches puberty and he did not prevent him. Sending Adults to Houses! Among them: Whoever sends an adult due to his lack of knowledge, and this is great ignorance. Indeed we belong to Allah and indeed to Him we shall return. Consequences of Non-Compliance: Know that non-compliance leads to corruption by the entry of foreigners (non-Mahram) upon foreigners. Sometimes this is by the man's choice, and sometimes by his wife's choice. Bringing the Brother to the Wife! Among people is one who brings his brother to his wife and says: He is my brother so do not be shy of him. One Who Manages His Craft in His House! Among people is one who has a craft like a weaver, tailor, and the like, working his craft in his house. His workers and boys work with him, so his wife enters upon them in his presence, talks to the workers, addresses them, chats with them and they chat with her. They do not deny the prohibition in looking nor in speech. Perhaps the master is absent for his need in the market, and orders his wife to do for the worker what he needs of "spinning" yarn, or what he needs, and they do not deny that! That became a habit, and intimacy and love occur between foreigners by this malicious habit. Talk and joking are repeated between them until modesty goes from them. This is from lack of chivalry. Bringing in Servants, Farmers, and Tillers: Among them is one who brings into his house people from his servants, entourage, farmers, tillers, sowers, fodder carriers, and hoers from freemen and slaves upon his family, daughters, folk, and neighbors, while they are foreigners to them, to take out the fodder tool and feed and the like of what they need. They look at his folk and family and they do not cover from them. Perhaps some talk to others and that became a habit among them. They do not see that as forbidden, nor do they deny it. Few refrain from their entry except one with jealousy for his family, or who has fear of Allah Almighty. We ask Allah for well-being. Chapter: On Questions Asked by Some Poor (Sufis) Regarding Matters Innovated by a Group of Muslims.

book_title: Solace of Sorrows to Avoid Sitting with Youths and Women
text: First Question: What is the saying of the masters, the scholars, the Imams of religion and scholars of Muslims regarding a group of Muslims who permitted looking at the face of a beautiful beardless boy, buying him for a large sum, giving his price to their Sheikhs, and being alone with him with a foreign man? Some of them hide him under his cloak, and some hide him with him in his garment. The foreign man "Yasharshihuhu" (dandles/plays with him), which is placing the chest of the beautiful beardless boy on his chest and shaking him so his heart flutters as the pigeon bird flutters. If they invite a stranger, they order him to wash his hands before putting them in the vessel. If he wipes them on the clothes of his body, they all flee from him. If a morsel falls from him, they say to him: It became impure. They do not pray behind a stranger Imam even if he was the Imam of Mecca and Medina - upon its dweller best prayer and peace - or Jerusalem. They do not greet him nor follow his actions. They say to a man: If a man insults Imam Abu Bakr and Umar, may Allah be pleased with them, and repents, is his repentance accepted? If he says: Yes, it is accepted, they kill him. If a stranger dies among them, they do not attend his funeral. They do not marry anyone from other than their kind. When a man marries a stranger man [to his daughter], their Sheikhs say to him: Do you marry [to] so-and-so?! So they isolate him and prevent his children from him until the Sheikhs are pleased with him. Is the term 'Innovator' (Bid'i) applied to these people? Must they be shunned? Is looking at their faces not permissible? Is dealing with them not lawful? What is obligatory upon them legally? And what is the ruling of Allah Almighty according to you in that? Give us a Fatwa, rewarded, may Allah reward you! The Answer: Deeming lawful what was mentioned above is Kufr (disbelief). If they repent, [good], otherwise they are killed. A man wiping his hand on his garment is not forbidden. A falling morsel does not become impure; rather eating it is recommended. The repentance of youths is accepted. Killing them for saying it is accepted is forbidden; if they deem that lawful, they are killed. These are people of innovation and misguidance. The ruler must support Allah Almighty, support the people of religion, and help in undertaking the interests of Muslims by uncovering these misguided innovators and their likes. If they repent, [good], otherwise he kills them by the legal way, this being the case. And Allah knows best the truth. Fatwa given by the Allama Sheikh Shams al-Din bin al-Imam, may Allah Almighty keep him in goodness and safety. He gave the fatwa and wrote it with his hand. Another Answer to the Previous Questions: The Imam, the Allama, Abu Abdullah Shams al-Din Muhammad bin al-Imam al-Shadhili said, then Sheikh Shihab al-Din Ahmad bin Nasr al-Baghdadi said about this question with another answer: As for their mentioned action regarding the beardless boy, it is the ugliest of ugliness and the most obscene of obscenities. They must be fought for that with what binds them of Hadd punishments and Ta'zir befitting them legally, deterring them customarily and naturally. As for their not praying behind others, it contradicts them based on what they are upon of their lowly innovation and heinous misguidance: That whoever opposes them, prayer behind him is not valid. Disagreement occurred among the Salaf - may Allah be pleased with them - in many branches, and none of them refrained from praying behind one who opposed him in his belief, for the word of Islam encompasses them. Their belief in the impurity of the morsel is part of their ignorance and misguidance. Likewise, their belief in the non-acceptance of the repentance of the insulter of one of the two Sheikhs - may Allah be pleased with them - is contrary to what the majority of Muslims are upon regarding the right of Allah Almighty. As for the right of the oppressed, even if it is said it does not drop by repentance, it belongs to the rulings of the Hereafter. Rather, it is permissible to interact with the one repenting from wrongs against creation after his truthfulness in repentance, due to his inability to satisfy an adversary. For Allah Almighty commanded giving respite to the insolvent for his insolvency. Likewise, everyone who owes a right he is unable to perform is excused. It is not a flaw in him if truthfulness in his repentance and sincerity of his intention is known from him. Rarely do we count this sect in evidence due to their excessive ignorance and Satan's hold on their forelocks. The ruler - may Allah grant him success - must rebuke them from this innovation and deter them from it with what befits them legally, deterring them customarily and naturally. Allah knows best the truth. A Question about the Beardless Boy Also! What is the saying of the masters, the scholars, Imams of religion and scholars of Muslims regarding a group of Muslims who permitted looking at the face of a beautiful beardless boy, seclusion with him, hugging him, and buying the boy for a price to take him as a friend (Khidn), calling him "Sharshuh" or "Bidayah"? Among them is a sect that did not pray behind an Imam unless they knew his father and grandfather. They say to a man: What do you say about the insulter of Abu Bakr and Umar, may Allah be pleased with them, if he repents; is his repentance accepted or not?! If he says: His repentance is accepted, they kill him. Is the term 'Innovation' applied to these? Must they be shunned and not dealt with? Is looking at their faces permissible? What is obligatory upon them legally? What is Allah's ruling on them? Give us a Fatwa, rewarded, may Allah reward you. The Fatwa:

book_title: Solace of Sorrows to Avoid Sitting with Youths and Women
text: Our master and Sheikh Sa'd al-Din al-Dayri al-Hanafi, may Allah prolong his life, answered saying: Praise be to the Guide to the Truth. The question about these ignorant misguided ones has been repeated. The detailed answer about their rulings and the summary of their ruling has been obtained: That deeming lawful the association with the "beardless boy" in the mentioned manner is Kufr (disbelief), especially if he believes it is an act of worship to draw closer. His leaving the following of Muslim Imams is an innovation and opposition to the transmitted Sunnah. As for their denial of the validity of the youth's repentance, in that is a rejection of the indication of the Clear Book; for its generality implies the permissibility of repentance from every sin with its legal condition. No sin is greater than denying the Lord, Glory be to Him and Exalted, and the repentant from it, acknowledging the reality of His Lordship, it is accepted from him and his punishment drops. Allah Almighty knows best. Then Sheikh Shihab al-Din al-Sarkhasi al-Shafi'i, may Allah keep him, informed us agreeing with this answer and said at its end: My answer is the answer of Sheikh Sa'd al-Din al-Dayri, may Allah be pleased with him. A Third Question: Regarding a group following people known as "Mutawwa'ah" who see companionship of boys, looking at them, and seclusion with them [as permissible], and see dancing in mosques and clapping. People from Ahl al-Sunnah came to them and said to them: This is forbidden, you are committing innovations not on the path of truth. A group of them returned and repented to Allah. Then when the people [Ahl al-Sunnah] left them, those who repented forbade them from following Ahl al-Sunnah, and they compelled them, forced them, and made them swear not to follow Ahl al-Sunnah. What is the ruling of these Sheikhs? And those who followed them and those who made them swear? Our Master the Imam, the Flag, Shams al-Din bin Hamid, may Allah pardon him, answered: These people called "Mutawwa'ah", it is forbidden to follow them in what they rely on of great corruptions of associating with beardless boys and seclusion with them, because looking at a beardless boy with desire, according to what scholars corrected, and mixing with them and associating with them in seclusion is the greatest danger. As for clapping with the palm, as resemblance to women, it is also forbidden. Likewise dancing in mosques. It is not lawful to associate with them nor follow them in these reprehensible acts. The ruler - may Allah Almighty support him - must ask them to repent from the evil, and disperse their gathering from this malicious meeting, and he will be rewarded for that. As for one who repents from that, it is not permissible for him after repentance to mix with them nor agree with them. Whoever is forced to return to them, and they made him swear under duress, and he is able to escape them with one of strength among them, it is not malicious to me [text unclear/corrupt: 'lam yakhbuth li'? possibly 'lam yahnath li' - he does not break oath? context implies ruling on oath/duress]. As for if he believed the permissibility of sins in mosques and its lawfulness therein is forbidden for them, they disbelieve by that and are asked to repent. If they do not repent, they are killed; because whoever deems lawful what Allah Almighty forbade has disbelieved. End. Sheikh Imam, the Scholar, Ala' al-Din al-Qutni, may Allah pardon him, also answered this question saying: These are a people who went astray and exited the path of truth and the school of Ahl al-Sunnah. The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "My nation will split into seventy-three sects, one of which is saved and the rest in the Fire." These are from the sects that are in the Fire; for the Saved Sect is what he and his companions, peace and blessings be upon him, were upon. Imam Malik, may Allah be pleased with him, said: What appeared of this religion is truth, and what was hidden of it is falsehood, due to His saying: (To make it prevail over all religion). These people, if they believe that seclusion with youths and looking at them is permissible, they have disbelieved. The rulers - may Allah support them - must kill them and cleanse the earth of them if they do not repent. If they believe it is forbidden, they have committed debauchery (Fisq) and their probity drops. The rulers - may Allah Almighty support them - must punish them with severe discretionary punishment (Ta'zir), and rebuke and deter them from that. If they do not return from this, fight them. As for the one they made swear not to associate with Ahl al-Sunnah, no expiation (Kaffarah) is obligatory upon him for associating with Ahl al-Sunnah, for he is forced on the oath. End. Then he answered with another answer saying: There is no doubt that Ahl al-Sunnah are the elite of this nation. Whoever follows them and imitates them has walked the path of truth and the way of the successful. Whoever strays from their path has strayed from guidance and walked the path of the perished. These are a people who committed innovations, prohibitions, and reprehensible matters. No one of the Imams of the Salaf permitted the permissibility of what they do. If they persist in that, they are major destructive sins. If they believe it is permissible; it may lead to Kufr; because it is from the rules that whoever believes the permissibility of a prohibition has disbelieved. They must repent from that, return to the truth, and follow guidance. If they do not, the rulers - may Allah Almighty support them - must punish them with severe Ta'zir, rebuke them from that, and return them to the path of truth. As for one forced to swear, there is no expiation on him if he returns and follows Ahl al-Sunnah. Chapter: Is There a Cure for This Disease?

book_title: Solace of Sorrows to Avoid Sitting with Youths and Women
text: Ibn al-Qayyim said: If it is said: Is there with all that a cure for this incurable disease, i.e., what was mentioned earlier of sins! And a Ruqyah (incantation) for this deadly magic? What is the trick to repel this insanity? Is there a purposeful path to repentance? Can the one drunk with the wine of passion wake up? Can the lover possess his heart when love has reached its core? So whoever's heart and limbs are attached to the aforementioned sins, it is said: Yes, Allah Glory be to Him and Exalted has not sent down a disease but He sent down a cure for it, known by who knows it and ignored by who ignores it. Speech on the cure of this disease is from two ways: First: Cutting off its material before its arrival. Second: Uprooting it before its descent. Both are easy for whom Allah makes easy, and impossible for whom Allah does not help; for the reins of matters are in His hands. Lowering the Gaze and Its Benefits: As for the way preventing the occurrence of this disease, it is two things: First: Lowering the gaze as mentioned before, for the look is a poisoned arrow from the arrows of Iblis. In lowering the gaze are several benefits: First: It is compliance with the commands of his Lord, Blessed and Exalted. The happy one in this world is only happy by complying with His commands, and the wretched one in this world and the Hereafter is only wretched by wasting His commands. Second: It prevents the arrival of the poisoned arrow, which, were it to reach him, would be his destruction and the hardening of his heart. Third: It bequeaths the heart intimacy with Allah Almighty, and its gathering upon Allah. For unleashing the gaze scatters the heart and disperses it, and distances it from Allah Almighty. There is nothing more harmful to the heart than unleashing the gaze, for it causes alienation between the servant and his Lord, Blessed and Exalted. Fourth: It strengthens the heart and gladdens it, just as unleashing the gaze weakens and saddens it. Fifth: It earns the heart light just as unleashing it earns it darkness. Therefore, Allah Glory be to Him and Exalted mentioned a verse in Surah An-Nur following the command to lower the gaze, saying: (Tell the believing men to reduce [some] of their vision and guard their private parts). Sixth: It bequeaths true physiognomy (Firasah) by which one distinguishes between truth and falsehood, and the truthful and the liar. Shah al-Kirmani used to say: Whoever builds his outer self with following the Sunnah, and his inner self with constant observation (Muraqaba), lowers his gaze from prohibitions, restrains himself from desires, and feeds on the lawful, his physiognomy will not err. Allah Glory be to Him and Exalted rewards the servant for his deed with what is of the same genus as his deed. Whoever leaves something for Allah, Allah Almighty compensates him with better than it. So if he lowers his gaze for Allah from Allah's prohibitions, Allah Almighty compensates him by unleashing the light of his insight in exchange for confining his gaze for Allah Glory be to Him and Exalted, and opens for him the door of knowledge, faith, gnosis, and true illuminating physiognomy which is only attained by the insight of the heart. The opposite of this is what Allah described the people of Lot with, of blindness ('Amah) which is the opposite of insight (Basirah), saying: (Indeed, they are in their intoxication, wandering blindly). He described them with intoxication which is corruption of the mind, and blindness ('Amah) which is corruption of insight. So attachment to images causes corruption of the mind, blindness of insight, and intoxicates the heart. Seventh: It bequeaths the heart firmness, courage, and strength. So Allah Almighty gathers for him between the authority of insight and argument, and the authority of power and strength. Eighth: It spoils Satan's entry into the heart, for he enters with the look, and penetrates with it to the heart faster than the penetration of air in an empty space. Ninth: It empties the heart for thinking about its interests and engaging in them. Unleashing the gaze scatters that for him and intervenes between it and that, so his affairs fall apart, and he falls into following his desire and heedlessness of the remembrance of his Lord, Blessed and Exalted. Allah Almighty said: (And do not obey one whose heart We have made heedless of Our remembrance and who follows his desire and whose affair is ever [in] neglect). Unleashing the gaze causes these three things alone. Tenth: That between the eye and the heart is a passage or path that necessitates the transition of one by what occupies the other, and that it be rectified by its rectitude and corrupted by its corruption. If the look is corrupted, the heart is corrupted for it likewise. Regarding rectitude, if the eye is ruined and corrupted, the heart is ruined and corrupted, and becomes like a dump which is the place of impurities, filth, and dirt. It is not fit for the habitation of knowing Allah Almighty, loving Him, turning to Him, intimacy with Him, and joy in nearness to Him. Only opposites of that inhabit it. This is a pointer to some benefits of lowering the gaze that informs you of what is behind them. The Second Matter of the Cure: Occupying the heart with what repels it from that, and prevents falling into it: It is either a disturbing fear, or an unsettling love. Whenever the heart is devoid of fear of something whose loss is more harmful to it than obtaining this beloved, it finds no escape from loving images. Explanation of this: The self does not leave a beloved except for a higher beloved, or fear of a disliked thing whose occurrence is more harmful to it than losing this beloved. This requires two things from its owner; if one is missing, he does not benefit himself:

book_title: Solace of Sorrows to Avoid Sitting with Youths and Women
text: First: A correct insight by which he distinguishes between the degrees of the beloved and the disliked, so he prefers the higher of the two beloveds over the lower, and endures the lower of the two disliked things to be saved from the higher. This is specific to the intellect, and he is not considered sane who is contrary to that; rather animals might be in a better state than him. Second: Strength of resolve, patience, and empowerment in which he can perform this action and abandonment. Often a man knows the extent of difference, but the weakness of his self, determination, and resolve refuse him, so that he does not fall [short] except due to his baseness, greed, lowliness of self, and baseness of ambition. Such a person does not benefit himself nor does anyone else benefit from him. "Notices" First: The verses, hadiths, and chapters repeated in this book are for added benefit or returning profit. Second: This book is established by way of admonition and warning, so there is no objection if the speech moves from one school of thought (Madhhab) to another school, because speech in admonition does not depend on the speaker's school. Our Sheikh was asked about some of his gatherings where he gathers speech from his school and the school of others. He said: If the speaker is speaking in admonition, he should not restrict himself to one school. If he is in a Fiqh lesson, he should not exit his school except for necessity. Conclusion on Explanation of Repentance and its Conditions, and Seeking Forgiveness and its Virtue: O Allah, we ask You for a good end with a righteous conclusion by Your grace and generosity. Chapter: On Repentance. Allah Almighty said: (And turn to Allah in repentance, all of you, O believers, that you might succeed). So He made repentance obligatory and encouraged it. He said: (Indeed, Allah loves those who are constantly repentant). My master Abu Al-Hajjaj Al-Uqsuri said: The reality of repentance is going to the King, the Bestower. The evidence for it is His Almighty's saying: (Indeed, I am going to my Lord; He will guide me). Repentance is of two types: Repentance from Allah Almighty upon the servant, and repentance from the servant to Allah Almighty. Repentance from Allah Almighty upon the servant is that He makes obedience beloved to him and disobedience hateful to him, and grants him success to act according to what He made beloved to him. His Almighty's saying: (But Allah has endeared to you the faith and has made it pleasing in your hearts and has made hateful to you disbelief, defiance and disobedience). This is the repentance from Him Almighty upon the servant. From this repentance arises the servant's repentance. The Almighty said: (Then He turned to them so they could repent), i.e., He turned to them so that they would repent, because unless Allah Almighty turns to the servant, repentance does not come from him. For this meaning it was said: "Care comes before guardianship (Wilayah), and consequents are built on antecedents." The witness for that from the Great Quran is His Almighty's saying: (Deluded away from the Qur'an is he who is deluded). i.e., He turns away from faith in the Quran, listening to it, and understanding it, who was turned away from it in eternity (pre-existence) and upon whom misery and deprivation were decreed, and the Pen ran. We ask the Generous for [a good] conclusion. The repentance of the repentant is known in four things: First: He restrains his tongue from superfluity and backbiting. Second: No envy or enmity is seen in his heart. Third: He leaves evil brothers, for they are the ones who carry him to reject this intent, and confuse the validity of this resolve for him. Fourth: He is prepared for death, regretful, seeking forgiveness for his past sins, striving. Explanation of the Meaning of Sincere Repentance (Tawbah Nasuh): Our Sheikh said: The Sheikhs said: It reached us from Ubayy bin Ka'b, may Allah be pleased with him, said: I said: O Messenger of Allah, what is sincere repentance? He said: "Regret for the sin, then you never return to it." Maimun bin Mahran, may Allah be pleased with him, said: From Ibn Abbas, may Allah be pleased with them both: How many a repentant comes to the Resurrection thought to be repentant, but is not repentant, because he did not perfect the doors of repentance. Abdullah bin Shumayl, may Allah be pleased with him, said: As long as the servant's heart persists on one sin, his deed is suspended in the air. If he repents from that sin, [good], otherwise his deed remains suspended. Scholars, may Allah be pleased with them, said: If a servant repents from a sin but not another, repentance from the sin he repented from is valid, and the sins he did not repent from remain upon him, he is punished for them, until he repents from all. Explanation of the Stations of Repentance:

book_title: Solace of Sorrows to Avoid Sitting with Youths and Women
text: Our Sheikh said: Know that the stations of repentance are ten: Regret for the sin by quitting it, abandoning returning to it with much seeking of forgiveness, exiting all ignorance by learning what is necessary of obligations, moving from minor to major sin [avoidance? text might mean moving away from minor to avoid major], returning injustices; what he cannot return he resolves to return, and if he finds something to return in place of the injustice, believing in self-loathing. Al-Fudayl bin Iyad, may Allah have mercy on him, said: Whoever loathes himself for Allah, Allah secures him from His loathing. Among them is leaving desires and decrease [in worldly things?], abandoning your evil companion brothers, rectifying your food and clothing, increasing weeping and pleading to Allah Almighty for pardon for what has passed, and leaving actions whose practice brings sins to a person, otherwise his repentance is not valid. Every repentance for which a sign is not seen on the limbs, how fast is its return!! The sign is decrease in the body, lack of greed, and much weeping. This is validated by His Almighty's saying: (Except those who repented and corrected themselves and made evident - so those I will accept their repentance, and I am the Accepting of repentance, the Merciful). Thus the repentant needs the effects of his repentance to be evident. Explanation of the Reality of Repentance: Sign of Repentance: Know that the reality of repentance in the heart is that the repentant hates the sin as he used to love it, weeps from it if he remembers it, and leaves it as he used to take it. Sign of Abandonment (Khidhlan): Everything has a sign. The sign of abandonment is leaving weeping over the sin. The sign of the repentant in his repentance is seeking forgiveness from Allah and intensity of grief (Kamad). Meaning of Kamad: Necessary fear. People regarding repentance are in five directions: A man procrastinating, and a woman procrastinating repentance, deceived by long hope. This is the one deserving punishment from Allah Almighty. A man repented with his heart but his self calls him to what Allah Almighty dislikes; this one needs discipline for it by fasting, and cutting off desires until he weakens it from what Allah Almighty dislikes. If it weakens, he becomes strong to oppose it; this is his benefit, so Allah Almighty gives him according to his truthfulness in struggling against his self. A repentant man addicted to accountability has stood over himself in the position of an adversary fearing for its first nature, lest it falls from the eye of Allah Almighty, and his enemy Iblis and the brethren of devils triumph over him; this is the one deserving of Allah Almighty's guardianship (Wilayah). Know that the greatest of stations after repentance is Prayer with its conditions, obligations, and Sunnahs; for it is established from him, peace and blessings be upon him: "The first thing a man is held accountable for is his prayer, then after that his women and what his right hand possesses. If he treated them well and taught them worship, Allah treats him well." Explanation of the Meaning of Repentance:

book_title: Solace of Sorrows to Avoid Sitting with Youths and Women
text: The Imam Sheikh, my master Abd al-Aziz al-Dirini, Allah's mercy be upon him, said: The meaning of Tawbah (Repentance): Return. It is said 'Taba', 'Anaba', and 'Aba' meaning: Returned. Repentance is returning from blameworthy descriptions to praiseworthy descriptions. It is said for one who returned from oppositions out of fear of Allah's punishment "Anaba", so he is Munib. And whoever returned out of glorification of Allah's Majesty "Aba", so he is Awwab. It is said: The beginning of repentance is an awakening from Allah Almighty falling into the heart, so the servant remembers his negligence and offense, despite the continuity of Allah Almighty's blessings upon him. So he knows that sins are killing poisons, fearing from them the occurrence of the disliked and the loss of the beloved in this world and the Hereafter. If this knowledge occurs to him, it bears fruit as a state (Hal), which is regret for wasting Allah Almighty's right. Then regret bears fruit as action, which is rushing to good deeds, performing obligations, returning injustices, and resolving to correct what is coming. If these three are organized, it is Repentance. The meaning of the Prophet's saying, peace and blessings be upon him: "Regret is repentance" means its greatest pillar is regret; for it does not occur until preceded by the first pillar which is knowledge of the harm of sin. It is said: Repentance is protecting modesty, and constant weeping. It is said: Repentance is regret for what passed and correction of what is coming. It is said: Repentance is that the servant knows his audacity against Allah and sees Allah's forbearance with him, not permitting the earth to swallow him or the fire to burn him for the sins he committed, then he repents from the sin and resolves not to return to it as milk does not return to the udder. It is said: Repentance is taking off the garment of harshness and spreading the carpet of loyalty. Sahl bin Abdullah said: Repentance is replacing blameworthy movements with praiseworthy movements, and that is not completed except by solitude, silence, and eating lawful things. Meaning: Isolation from evil associates. In the Hadith: "The one who repents from sin is like one who has no sin." My master Abu Madyan, may Allah have mercy on him, said: The disturbance of the heart due to the shock of awakening is weightier than the deeds of the two heavy ones (Jinn and Mankind). Sahl said: Repentance is leaving procrastination. Sari al-Saqati said: Repentance is not forgetting your sin. Al-Bushanji said: If you remember your sin and find no sweetness for it, that is repentance. Dhu al-Nun said: The reality of repentance is that the earth narrows upon you despite its vastness until you have no escape, and your soul narrows upon you as Allah Almighty said: (Until when the earth was straitened for them despite its vastness, and their own souls were straitened for them) the verse. It was said to Abu Hafs: Why does the repentant hate the world? He said: Because it is an abode in which he disobeyed Allah. Some said: Repentance is a man sensing the term (death). Know that the sin after repentance is [worse than] seventy before it. Yahya bin Mu'adh said: A slip after repentance is uglier than seventy before it. Repentance is not upright except by constant struggle and continuous sorrows. Explanation of Conditions of Repentance: Know that conditions of repentance are four: Exiting the circle of opposition, accompanying regret, returning what concerns [rights] in the liability, and resolving not to return to the homeland of opposition. He said: The beginning of repentance is the servant waking up from the slumber of heedlessness by success from Allah, so he sees what bad negligence and shortcoming he is in despite the continuity of Allah Almighty's blessings. If he listens with his heart to the deterrents occurring to his mind, he resolves to repent. If Allah grants him success for the resolve, he quits and repents. The least obligatory upon the repentant is abandoning his brothers whom he used to accompany in disobedience. Some scholars said: One should abandon the places where he used to disobey Allah, and this is called: Hijrah (Migration). He, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "The Muhajir (Migrant) is he who abandons evil." He also said: "The Muhajir is he who abandons what Allah forbade." Then by persisting in sitting with the righteous, and sitting in gatherings of Dhikr, his fear strengthens, his remembrance continues, the knot of persistence dissolves from his heart, he stops engaging in prohibitions, and restrains himself from following desires. So he leaves the slip immediately, regrets what passed of ugly deeds, and resolves not to return to the like of it in the future. If he continues on that, he is the one granted success in purpose. If he returns to a sin, he must renew repentance. One should not cut off hope; for every term has a decree. Allah is the Helper to reveal the veil and act by the Sunnah and the Book. Indeed, He is Generous, Accepter of Repentance. Seeking Forgiveness (Istighfar).

book_title: Solace of Sorrows to Avoid Sitting with Youths and Women
text: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Increase in seeking forgiveness, for seeking forgiveness eats up sins just as fire eats up wood and just as the sheep eats up green plants. If a person's scroll ascends to the sky and does not contain seeking forgiveness, it has no light. If it rises and contains seeking forgiveness, it has a shimmering light. If seeking forgiveness is not in it, it is dark (Yasir - possibly 'gloomy' or 'little' context suggests negative). Any people who sit in a gathering of idle talk then seal it with seeking forgiveness, their gathering is written for them as all seeking forgiveness." The Mighty and Majestic said: "Is the son of Adam unable to seek forgiveness from Me a hundred times every day so I forgive him a thousand sins every day?" Therefore, the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Indeed, my heart becomes clouded, and I seek forgiveness from Allah a hundred times a day." From Abu Bakr Al-Siddiq, may Allah be pleased with him, he said: I heard the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, in the Farewell Pilgrimage saying: "Indeed Allah Almighty has gifted you your sins upon seeking forgiveness. So whoever seeks forgiveness with a sincere intention, He forgives him. Whoever says 'La ilaha illa Allah', his scale tips. Whoever prays upon me, I will be his intercessor on the Day of Resurrection." Allah Almighty said in His Great Book: (Ask forgiveness of your Lord. Indeed, He is ever a Perpetual Forgiver). And Almighty said: (And ask forgiveness of Allah. Indeed, Allah is Forgiving and Merciful). Some worshippers said: My sins were presented to me in the day (dream/vision?); what I sought forgiveness from Allah for was erased, and what I did not seek forgiveness for remained. It was said: Iblis - may Allah Almighty curse him - says: I adorned sins greatly - i.e., for this nation - but they broke my back with seeking forgiveness. No trial descends upon them from which they seek forgiveness from Allah but it disperses their desires. From Abu Sa'id al-Khudri, may Allah be pleased with him: "That Iblis said to his Lord: By Your Might and Majesty, I will not cease misleading the sons of Adam as long as spirits are in them. His Lord said to him: By My Might and Majesty, I will not cease forgiving them as long as they seek My forgiveness." Narrated by Imam Ahmad. Ended with the praise of Allah, His aid, and His good success. Allah is the Granter of success to what is right. To Him belong favor and grace. Prayer and peace be upon the most noble of creation, our master Muhammad, his family, and all his companions. Praise be to Allah, Lord of the Worlds.
